description:
I'm so glad this place is still here. For real, I get worried when small business food joints with stellar eats & treats open in the City because the competition is tough. Grubbin' sandwiches are IT! 

They do not skimp out on the meat or other ingredients in their sandwiches. I've had their vegetarian sandwiches (Crunchin' and Tastin'), and they are both dee-lish and filling! 

The fam loves it too. We've been coming since it opened and we will continue to!
author: Lani S.

description:
Finding a GOOD basic vegan deli sandwich can be hard to find and I am elated to have found this place!

I ordered a custom sandwich with lettuce, tomato, pickles, avocado and cucumbers with mustard on dutch crunch bread. When I say it was quite possibly the best sandwich I'd had in years... The bread was warm and soft. Some dutch crunch is hard when you bite into it and scratches the roof of your mouth but this bread just melted! I am now a loyal fan!

Parking was easy and I didn't wait long for my food. Super fast and nice service. I highly recommend!
author: Angela H.

description:
Grubbin' is so damn good that I came back for the second day in a row for an encore.

Listen, everyone working here is 100% efficient and friendly. Your food will get to you lightning quick because the kitchen is right behind the cashier and they will start making your order AS SOON AS THEY HEAR YOU SAY IT.

The food itself is absolutely amazing. They have so many options for bread, whether you like a typical Dutch crunch or just want to go conventional and have it between two slices of white bread. They've got all the sides you need, from fries to chicken nuggets to wings, and even just plain old chips. The best part--they serve your sandwich so piping hot that you won't even be able to hold it for the first few seconds. The sandwiches themselves are so filling that I can usually down a Subway footlong in one sitting, but I can only eat half of a Grubbin' sandwich!

I definitely recommend the sweet or spicy mouth waterin' chicken sandwich. It's delicious and has sooo many flavors and a generous amount of chicken tenders. If you've ever been to NYC, it reminds me of a better version of a Sticky's sandwich. 

Overall, I completely love this place. It's like paying for Subway and getting something waaaaay better.
author: Claire C.

description:
SO DELICIOUS!!! Drop everything and grab one NOW!

I love delis and I love sandwiches. This place did not disappoint. The exterior is really plain and the inside is nothing to write home about, but the sandwiches are AMAZEballs.

The menu is written on the chalkboard and their selection might be a little overwhelming. I was initially skeptical bc their sandwiches sounded a little too "fancy." But the taste has won me over.

I ordered a Grubbin sandwich and it came out hot and fresh on that delicious dutch crunch! It was pretty meaty and the flavors paired well. The prices are reasonable and the staff is super friendly. We couldn't finish our sandwiches and they packed them up for us to go. BTW they were still good the next day toasted up!
author: Junella T.

description:
Stop everything and head over to Grubbin' RIGHT NOW. I first discovered this joint a few years ago and have been a loyal customer since. 

THE MENU: the selection of sandwiches is not as extensive as other sandwich joints (i.e. Lou's sandwiches) but thats exactly what makes GRUBBIN so darn good! Give their classics a try and trust me...you will be hooked!

TIP: The spot itself is quite small but if you come after peak hours, you will secure a table! Parking may also be difficult in this area but I always manage to find a spot right in front.

-----
For more food tips, follow me on Instagram @munchieswith_m
author: Mary L.

description:
The shop may be small but the sandwiches sure aren't! 

My boyfriend and I stopped by today for a late lunch/early dinner and ordered the Grubbin' It and the Spicy Mouth Waterin' - both on dutch crunch bread. Both came out piping hot (I got a bit too excited and pretty much burned myself on my Spicy Mouth Waterin' but it was worth it!) First off, the bread is perfect and it such a great textural element against the meatiness of the sandwiches. And the sauces - wow - so bright in flavor and they just really tie everything together! 

Of the two, I preferred the Grubbin' It (mainly because I just prefer the meats in this more) but would recommend both! 

They have quite a few options so I'll definitely be back to try more!
author: Janice L.

description:
Cozy little sandwich shop in San Francisco. 

The Spicy Mouth Waterin' is one of my favorite sandwiches to get! The dutch crunch bread is phenomenal with the chicken. The grubbin' sauce comes together so well with the slightly toasted bread, fried chicken, lettuce and more. This sandwich doesn't taste spicy at all, however. Still, one of the better sandwich shops in San Francisco. 

The prices are reasonable and the staff is friendly. There's a TV playing entertainment and several tables for people to situate at. Overall, a lowkey and chill place.
author: Karen Y.

description:
Quality meats and breads. The sprouts really give it a nice texture and flavor. The grub sauce is pretty good too. 

We went with the Lickin' and Droolin' - both pretty good. Very reasonably priced and good customer service. Would def come back if I'm in the area and want a good sandwich.
author: Alic H.

description: Really good sandwich flavor combos. Definitely call ahead and get your order to go since the wait can be long!
author: Jessica C.

description:
Grubbin' ... this was a term my friends and I used back in the day to describe something incredibly tasty. Recently, I saw several of my friend's posts of their sandwiches, so I had to make sure to make a trip here when I'm back in the Sunset of SF. 

Right after the New Year, I wan in town and called my friend who posted the photos and came here for lunch. The place is small, a few tables that seat 3 to 4 ppl.  A large menu hangs on one wall while a big screen is on the other. 

Their signature sandwich appropriately called the 'Grubbin' It' caught my eye. It has salami, smoked ham, pastrami and bacon, plus some plant stuff to counter the saltiness of the meats. I opted for the Dutch crunch roll. The crunch of the roll mixed with the salty meats, the bitterness of the sprouts made this one of the better sandwiches I've had in recent memory. 

We were also comped an order of hot & crispy tots. 
I can easily say if I lived in the Sunset, I'd be a regular too. 

Notes:
* Yelp check in gets you a free bag of chips
* Street metered parking. Many meters were jammed so you may need to use a credit card. 
* Self serve water by the counter
author: James L.

description: Spicey Mouth Waterin is delicious!  My first time ordering here.  I will definitely be back.
author: Cyprian S.

description: I can't believe I'm giving a sandwich shop 5 stars because I usually hate sandwiches but this place is sooo good! I usually get the Droolin' (pastrami, salami, lettuce, tomato, and spicy mayo sauce, on dutch crunch) and a side of the Grub Fries (garlic fries). They also have Mexican Coke (sugar coke), and together it's a trifecta.  Boyfriend is a sandwich connoisseur and he always gets the Grubbin' It sandwich. We're both addicted to this place. Plus the workers are really nice!
author: Vivian W.

description:
Maybe the best sandwich I've ever had. Stacks up with Ike's and any other sandwich shop I've been to in the Bay Area.

Small shop with some great side offerings as well, I'm looking forward to stopping by again and trying their other options.
author: Andrew E.

description:
Second time I've been to Grubbin' now and I definitely enjoyed this experience more than last time. I ordered the house recommended Grubbin' and found it made just right. The meat (pastrami, smoked ham, salami, and bacon) was stacked nice and high but admittedly, it was composed mostly of pastrami and ham. Pesto and grub sauce added a nice creamy richness while the non-negotiables (lettuce, tomatoes, and pickles) brought it all together. Dutch crunch was also the perfect vessel for this sandwich.

To complement my sandwich, I opted for a side of tots. Fried fresh, they were crispy and piping hot when delivered, but were a tad overfried in my opinion. Still good though. Certainly satisfied my craving for something fried.

All in all, nearly $14 for a sandwich lunch isn't the cheapest on the block, but it was certainly a taste that did merit the price.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
Great sandwich shop located in the Sunset district of SF. Stopped by here for a late Sunday lunch (~3pm) with a couple friends and surprisingly it was quite bustling. 

I ordered their Juicin' sandwich, which came with turkey and bacon as the main meats, with some avacado, provolone cheese, and pesto sauce. You can choose your bread option and I went with the standard dutch crunch. This was a solid sandwich -- a good amount of fresh turkey and bacon bits sandwiched between a good amount of veggies (tomatoes, lettuce, avacado) and with a good pesto and cheese kick. Portion size was good for the price ($10).

Definitely highly recommend! They have a lot of different options to choose from.
author: Alvin W.

description: Came here 2 days ago. Got two tater tots, 1 grub fries [garlic fries], and grubbin it sandwich. Tater tots were $4.50 each, and the grub fries were $6. For SF, the tater tots were actually pretty big! You could share it between like 2 people. The fries size was not bad either. The grubbin it sandwich was 9.75 and was pretty good as well. They use a type of beansprout for the lettuce i believe, which had an interesting taste! Parking you could find around the streets, in front, or residential areas.
author: Kyle H.

description: I've been coming back to this place forever cause the sandwiches are handdown the best in the neighborhood. Everything on the menu is hella good. These are also one of the best vegetarian sandwiches I've tried too.
author: Jason X.

description: Been here a few times and it never disappoints. You can make your own sandwich or order from their specialty menu. I like to order the Droolin' sandwich. Great bread and the sandwiches are always stuffed, leaving me really full at the end.
author: Lillian B.

description:
To be fair, I had more "complex" sandwiches before from some other shops around that area, BUT, this place was fast, tasty and cute. Sandwich while on the simpler side was super tasty. The best surprise was: the dutch crunch. I usually very worried about it as it tends to be way too crunchy and not so much fun, but that one was fresh and tasty and not overly crunchy (that is how I prefer it).
Loved it! Will come back!
author: Nastia R.

description:
The store was a mess when I came in. Dirty tables, overfilled garbage, boxes of supplies everywhere. There was a disorderly a mess behind the counter in area that food was being prepared, thus I was hesitant, but my friend recommended this place so I ordered anyways. 

There was no one in front of us at the store, 3 people came in about 3-4 min after us, the sandwiches took like 15 min to make - which I thought was super weird since there were three employees. Sure if they were cleaning up the tables, the trash inside, organizing supplies or tidying the place up I would understand, but nope they were just chilling doing the minimum. 

I thought it was odd that 1 group of people who came in after us got their food 5 min before we did. 

I tried a roast beef wasabi Sandwich & the fried chicken strip sandwich as we spilt sandwiches to try them both. The meat in the sandwiches was generous proportion wise, the Dutch crunch we got was great, the Sandwhich was good overall. 

This is the type of place I would rather have a had never see the inside and just be unaware of the messy conditions. If things are a mess everywhere I can see, I just don't trust that the conditions in which the food is prepared, stored and handled. 

It's 1 block away from Lou's so I really don't think it compares sandwich wise - they do make fries and tots so I can see that appeal to some. 

Long review short, I don't trust my friends recommendations anymore
author: John O.

description: Ok. So checked in Yelp for a good lunch place while visiting near SFSU. I have to say that the sandwiches my family and I ordered are among some of the best I can remember eating. I highly recommend the Dutch crunch roll as the bread choice.
author: Neil Y.

description:
This is my favorite sandwich shop in the Sunset. Their fixings to bread ratio is perfect, and the bread is always the right amount of crunch and heartiness.

My go to is the Juicin' with pepper jack.

Oh, the best part about this place is that you can get a side of hot fries or tarot tots with your sandwich!

Skip Lou's am go straight to Grubbin'
author: Mimi T.

description: Food here never disappoints. The wait for the food is a bit long during lunch time but it is still worth it because the portion of the food is perfect size and the price is not bad for the size of it. Typically during the school year there will be more people because of the high schoolers but definitely worth trying the Lickin' and the Fishin'
author: Tiffany C.

description: Great place for sandwiches. If you like the SF sandwich variety they got it at Grubbin'! Dutch Crunch!
author: Jeremy S.

description:
Great sandwiches and everyone that works there is so customer focused!   Would definitely recommend Grubbin' to everyone!     

Plus everyone should go a place that does tots as well as Grubbin'.    

Secret menu item suggestion: Nacho Tots!  Tots w/ cheese, avocado, pico (tomatoes, onions, cilantro, jalapeño), bacon, olives, green onions... most of the stuff they already have for sandwiches.
author: Fun T.

description:
I'll start by saying that I'm a fan of Lou's Sandwiches Cafe down the block. I'm usually at Lou's on Saturday, after my son's baseball game. But last week the game was moved to Sunday, and on Sunday Lou's Cafe is closed, and I had heard and seen good things about Grubbin, so my family and I went to try it out. 

The menu is cute, lots of funny names and such. The description of each sandwich is kinda hard to read though; maybe that's just me. The script font makes it stylish but confusing. But that's just me, so no worries.

I decided to order a build your own regular sandwiches, a turkey and cheese and a pastrami. The service was great; friendly and welcoming. No problems with checking in for a free bag of chips. 

The sandwiches came out pretty quickly. Compared to Lou's, the sandwiches are smaller. You get less meat and less filling. Maybe that's just me because others have commented on the huge quantity of meat. Both my wife and son made similar comments about the smaller size, so ymmv. The pastrami was made incorrectly; there was both pastrami and ham inside. I didn't want to wait so I just accepted it.

The sandwiches were ok. The grubbin' sauce wasn't special in any way. I couldn't taste anything special about it. There really wasn't much sauce. The meat was just your average meat. I don't have anything really to add... the sandwiches were decent. If Lou's was open, I would go there. If not, I might come back here. It's nothing special, but it will fill your tummy for a quick lunch.
author: Dom L.

description: Oh my goodness! So tasty.  Turkey, avocado, bacon and grub sauce (garlic aioli). Hot fresh tater tots! So glad we stopped here!
author: Dawn T.

description: This is actually my favorite sandwich place in the entire world. I was trying to track this place down for months and I finally got it. They have the best sandwiches with the best homemade sauce. I am so happy I found it and I will be going back to San Francisco soon; literally just to eat the spicy sandwich...
author: Noesh H.

description:
Ikes sandwiches? forget that! Come here instead. A quick yelp search led me here on my trip to San Francisco. My typical SF trip consists of clam chowder but I wanted something a bit lighter. This place is seriously one of those hole in the wall places. I was recommended the JUICIN and SPICY MOUTH WATERING. 
I got two both and split with the boyfriend

Spicy mouth watering $10
a chicken sandwich with a mild sauce (kind of like in n out sauce, or thousand island with a kick) on your choice of bread.
I am a baby for spicy foods but spicy mouth water just had a little kick which was perfect. The chicken had the perfect crunch to it and was very thick and juicy! Served on a double crunch roll, game over. Hands down the better sandwich!

Juicing $10
A BLT sandwich with ham? topped with a pesto/ranch like sauce on your choice of bread.
I am not a fan of BLT, but this sandwich was something else. There was so much ham, which is a great thing because you get your bang for your buck. This was satisfying, but it did not hit my taste buds the way the "spicy mouth watering" did.

We also got a large fries to share! 

Get the double crunch roll, you will not regret it.

Don't forget to check in to get a free bag of chips!
author: Emily L.

description:
This is probably one of my favorite sandwich places ever - and yes, it's way better than Ike's or Lou's. I was a former Lou's fan until I tried this place! 

I loooove bread and seriously, their dutch crunch is perfect *_* it goes well with any of their sandwiches! My go-to sandwich is "Juicin'" which has turkey, bacon and avocado (and the other fixings) when I'm in the area. Their sandwiches are HUGE, so definitely share or have an extra meal. Seriously. It's so good I try to finish the sandwich even though I shouldn't lmao.

Bonuses - accepts card, has stamp cards, and free chips if you check-in on yelp :)
author: Julie L.

description: Truly enjoyed "crushin"! Felt really satisfied after inhaling the sandwich. Perfect amount of aioli sauce which wasn't too harsh when I went back to work and didn't have garlic breath. Definitely will be back!
author: Cee B.

description: Super yummy sub sandwiches! Service is always courteous and quick. And they are not skimpy on the meat! One of my favorite places to go...
author: Darryl H.

description:
This is funny. It turns out they have been here for 3yrs, and i never noticed until the other day. 

Wow. So amazingly delicious. My friends and I ordered 3 different sandwiches and they were all amazing. 

Staff was very friendly and courteous. Wait time could be long but its so worth it. 

Luckily i live up the street, because this is gonna be my regular spot.
author: Dave B.

description: Great service, great sandwiches. Ordered through Grubhub multiple times, and pickup has been quick and on-time. No complaints!
author: Kelvin Y.

description: This place has Fast service, great sandwich, and friendly people. I will definitely be coming back.
author: Aaron P.

description: My favorite sandwich shop in the city!! Their Dutch crunch bread is always crunchy and flavorful and I love their combinations. They're very nice about customizations and most of the time service is pretty good. I also like the tater tots there - super crispy. My go to sandwich is the "cravin" which can usually feed both me and my guy friend with a side of tater tots (sandwiches are big). Parking is usually not to bad and these sandwiches also keep well if you want to grab one to go to the park or beach. (Pic is the quarter sandwich I already started eating because I was too hungry but you can see how fat it is)
author: Anna N.

description:
Lives up to its name! I had the Juicin' and it was definitely Grubbin! All the flavors and textures of the toasted sandwich melded very well. 

Will definitely come and try the other sandos.
author: Adrienne F.

description:
I'm not usually one to write bad reviews, but when a restaurant and its workers don't take food safety seriously, it really pisses me off. With that being said, my boyfriend and I came to Grubbin this afternoon for our first meal of the day. We haven't eaten any big meals since around 3pm yesterday, so there was virtually nothing in our stomachs.

We ordered the Spicy Chicken Sandwich as well as the Sweet Chicken Sandwich with a side of tater tots. While waiting for our sandwiches, we noticed a lot of flies buzzing around... There were honestly so many flies, that I had to shoo them away from me and the food every couple of minutes, which I thought was pretty annoying and a little gross. I know it's hard to keep flies under control but there has to be a reason why they keep coming around. Maybe food is left out on the prep counters?

Anyway, the food was good, however we both noticed that the sandwich made us incredibly thirsty for some reason.... I couldn't finish the rest of my sandwich because of that, so I opted to take it to go hoping to eat it later. 
Fast forward a half hour, we both get crazy stomach pains while shopping. At this point, we both realized that the sandwiches were no bueno. We now have to cancel our plans for the rest of the day since we've spent the last few hours taking turns in the restroom -_____- !!!! 

Looking back on some other Yelp reviews, I see that we weren't the only ones to experience this. Grubbin, please please please be careful with handling food!! I can't stress this enough. Please don't continue to make anyone else sick.
author: Audrey G.

description:
I was in the area and found the Yelp listing for Grubbin' so thought I'd give it a try. I love a good sandwich, especially when there are interesting combination of fillings. 

It was a Saturday around 1 pm. There wasn't a line, so I stepped right up and ordered. Everything on the menu sounds delectable, so it was really hard to decide. I went with the Grubbin' sandwich (Pastrami, Smoked Ham, Salami, Bacon, Sprouts, Cheddar Chesse, Pesto Aioli, and Grub Sauce) on Dutch Crunch. The bread seemed very fresh. It was crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. The toppings were also very fresh and the sandwich was stacked and wrapped neatly. It came out warm, but with the amount of meats stacked up, it wasn't warm all the way through. I think it would have been even better if it was warm throughout. 

Service was very friendly and it seemed like they had more than enough staff to handle a line. The dining area is pretty small, but they had Moana playing on the TV to entertain me while I was waiting. Parking can also be a challenge on the streets nearby, so allot some time for that. Overall, it was a very tasty sandwich, washed down with an Arancita San Pellegrino soda, for about $13. It was tad bit higher than I'd like to pay, but I'd still come back if I was in the area to try the other offerings on the menu.
author: Diane A.

description:
This spot has lots of seating for a sandwich place :) 

We got the juicin and droolin, both were yummy. The juicin was more savory and the droolin was more sweet. If you have a sweet tooth like me I'd suggest the droolin :). The Dutch crunch did hurt the top of my mouth but that's okay it was worth it. Lol


There's parking around this area which is a super plus in SF.
author: Melanie T.

description: I came here while on my lunch break hoping to get a quick meal. I saw lots of 5 star reviews and i was super excited to get some good food. It was very quick but not very good. It wasn't bad. But it wasn't good. I got the sweet chicken sandwich (forgot what it's called) It not only wasn't sweet, it didn't really have any flavor. The chicken breading didn't taste like didn't have much seasoning and the only sauce I could taste was maybe a lightly seasoned mayo? I came back in the store simply to ask for hot sauce to help the lack of flavor and they tried to charge me for that.  nevermind. Bye. Besides the fact I walked back in empty handed without my wallet, my sandwich shoulda came with flavor I shouldn't have to pay extra to put it on my food!!
author: Erika J.

description: FAVORITE sandwich spot in San Francisco. Get the Dutch crunch bread with your sandwich. Is a Bay Area favorite for a reason!
author: Erin J.

description:
When I first arrived, there's a short line in front of the door and eventually the line grew out and became really long. Good thing I was able to beat the crowd and came before the chaos came rushing in. 

Food quality: very fresh and hot when I first received my sandwiches. Ordered the grubbin and juicin sandwiches. I have to say, everything looked so good! Then the tater tots came out as well freshly fried!! Overall the food was great, crunchy bread and good stuffings in the middle. Personally I like the grubbin more than the juicin sandwich, because there's more variety of different meats in grubbin and when you bite into it, it is way more satisfying. Juicin sandwich is good too but it's only one type of meat however the good thing about this sandwich is included with avocado! Who wouldn't love some avocado in their sandwiches!?? The tater tots were good too, really fresh and crunchy!! But next time I would want to try the grubbin fries, looked even better!!


Food tip: check in on Yelp to get a free bag of chips!
author: Joanne C.

description:
With some delicious sandwiches, grubbin' is what you'll be doing here! 

You can make your own sandwich or pick one of their speciality sandwiches. I always order the Spicy Mouth Waterin' Sandwich (chicken tenders, spicy aioloi, ranch, and grunch sauce). They toast your sandwich unless you tell them otherwise. My friends and I agree that their Dutch Crunch is DA BOMB. Sandwiches are filling and super tasty - one of the best local sandwich spots in the area! 

Service is fast and friendly, usually I see the same people working. There's a TV and a few tables and seating inside. You can also get a free bag of chips if you check in on Yelp! 

I highly recommend checking this spot out. Great service, great sandwiches, great prices...great GRUBBIN'.
author: Kristal D.

description:
AHHH I love sandwiches!! These are so good! 

I got the Juicin - turkey, bacon, avo, with all the fixins. The garlic aioli is a MUST. Only negative (but not really a negative at all), the bacon wasn't really present, I even forgot there was suppose to bacon in the sandwich until I tasted a little nibble in the form of bacon bits as opposed to strips. But, the sandwich was super tasty without it so I'm not at all disappointed. My dad got the Grubbin - pastrami and salami with a spicy aioli and the works. He also enjoyed his a lot. 

I will be back for a delicious sandwich made by friendly staff.
author: Adriana G.

description: I'm not a really big fan of sandwiches unless it's Vietnamese sandwiches, but I love their Kickin' which is roast beef, bacon, pepper jack cheese, wasabi spread, and Grub Sauce. Their wasabi sauce definitely did it for me!
author: Christina C.

description: Delicious sandwiches!! We ordered the Droolin and the Kickin', wasabi was awesome! Had nuggets and tots for the kids. Great place we will be back.
author: Genevieve A.

description: Great sandwiches at a great price. Highly recommend the sweet mouth waterin! Not a lot of room to sit down but always an amazing sandwich.
author: Patrick T.

description:
It's grubbin' what can I say. When I'm in sandwich mode this is my go to spot. 

Their names for the sandwich different from most places. 

I've enjoyed all their different sandwiches, even the veggie ones. 

I always order the tatertots here. Very addicting. 

Sandwich are not small by any means. 

Good job grubbin'
author: Lyman C.

description: Erica is awesome, she made one of the best sandwiches I've eaten in a while in the Outer Sunset.  This is the Juicin' Turkey Sandwich that I ordered.  This is Ike's quality sandwiches out here.  Will definitely go here again.  The L takes you directly in front of it.  Very convenient.
author: Wilson K.

description: It's my first time here since I don't really come to Taraval. This place was recommended to me from a close friend of mine and she suggested I try their tater tots. This is exactly what I came here for. The ambience in here is very quiet, at least for a Thursday afternoon. They have tables inside and like one table outside plus a huge tv on the wall. Food came out quickly and the tots were heated up perfectly without being oily. My server/cashier; Alyssa was super nice and helpful. She even knows how to joke around instead of being the boring cashier. Everyone loves a girl that can joke around! Anyways this place is perfect to do homework and eat since it's quiet.
author: Lisa W.

description:
I have heard good things.
Stopped by to eat but so crowded - I was not able to wait.
I'll have to try again!
author: Carla J.

description: Update: still great, they do not deserve 4 stars just because I was cranky and annoying two years ago. Favs: spicy mouth waterin', fishin'
author: David G.

description: Great sandwich spot. I bought the Juicin' sandwich and the meat to veggie ratio was pretty generous. There was a lot of turkey in my sandwich and while I appreciated it, I would have gladly traded some of it for more of the veggies. I asked for extra pickles and I didn't get as much as I thought I would. All in all, good sandwich spot. Decently priced. Not a super huge sandwich, but it's enough to hit the spot. The dutch crunch they offer definitely hits the spot.
author: Thomas C.

description: I got the grubbin sandwich with everything!! The sandwich was very fulfilling which is what I tend to look for at deli places. It was packed with flavor as well! Customer service was very kind, I asked a lot of questions while ordering and they managed to walk me through a lot of it. They also brought our order to the tables we were sitting at (wasn't sure if they were suppose to or we just didn't hear them call our order, not really sure how that works) nonetheless would definitely come again!
author: S T.

description:
New favorite sandwich place. Take it as it is on the menu, as the chef intended! 

Sandwich names are little goofy, and they don't help me remember which is which - however delicious. The only thing that the goofy names do for me is remind me that they use goofy names.
author: Phil Y.

description:
The sandwiches here are very tasty but also very pricey. Ordered the 'grubbin' sandwich and it was delicious but expensive. Irving Subs sandwiches are a lot cheaper but may not be as tasty...and Irving Subs also use gross shredded lettuce where as Grubbin uses yummy pea shoots (think that's what they're called)
Also, very slow service with employees that seem to take care of online first.
author: Brooke F.

description: Their sandwiches are amazing !! Really good. I finished the whole thing so fast.. great service too. Just love this place.
author: L T.

description: This place sucks! I got food poisoning from their nasty ass sandwich. If i can give them zero star I would. So I ordered for pick up and my boyfriend picked it up for me. He got home, handed me my sandwich and i opened it. First thing I noticed, the bread was burnt, while i was eating it, i told my boyfriend that the sandwich was hella dry. Right after I finished the other half. I felt weak as if i was getting a fever. Sure enough i did, followed by stomach cramps. My stomach was aching the entire night and i felt sick, i was going to the bathroom every minute. Stay away from this place!!
author: April Rose C.

description:
Located on the streets of Taraval, next to a park and the police department, this little family business offers some great sandwiches. Parking is either residential or metered; it can be a hit or miss depending on the time of day you go. Service is friendly. Place is small with 2-3 tables and a window bar seating. Check in on yelp to get a free bag of chips!! 

Whenever I grabbed Ike's, my cousin would always tell me to go to Grubbin' instead. I never listened though, because it seemed out of the way (Ike's was at Serramonte.. 2 birds with 1 stone cause I could eat and shop!). My boyfriend tried this place out while nearby for a haircut and loved it! He introduced it to me and I thought it was pretty darn good .. still didn't beat Ike's for me at the moment. My first visit, my boyfriend and I split Juicin' and Droolin'. My most recent visit, I tried the Grubbin' It and LOVED it! All with Dutch Crutch & everything on it! :) 

Juicin' ($9) - Turkey, bacon, avocado, sprouts, provolone cheese, pesto aioli, and grub sauce. I thought this sandwich was good but not to my liking probably because I'm not much of a turkey meat person.. it was my boyfriend who loved this one. I'm biased! 

Droolin' ($8) - Pastrami, salami, pepper jack cheese, spicy aioli, and grub sauce. You can never go wrong with a sandwich topped with meats!! Loved this one because of the pastrami. 

Grubbin' It ($9)  - Pastrami, smoked ham, salami, bacon, sprouts, cheddar cheese, pesto aioli, and grub sauce. My new favorite sandwich!! It's soo good when topped with all these yummy meats. I didn't see it the first time I came and I regret it! But it made my mouth water. I guess I should've figured because it looks like the house sandwich with the name 'grubbin'. Totally recommend this one if you love meat! 

Aside from their specialty sandwiches, you can build your own as well. You can also add-on pickles, jalapenos, and pepperoncinis for freeeee. All sandwiches include lettuce, tomato, red onions, and mayo. My boyfriend also loves to order their fries. It's pretty good with it's fresh! 

Now that my boyfriend lives in the area, I guess they'll be seeing me more often ;)
author: Mandy G.

description:
UPDATE: I finally got to go return the $5 the restaurant sent me, and the staff was so sweet and understanding. 


Old review: I debated writing this, since the manager was so helpful in trying to correct my order, but since we ordered our food nearly 3 hours ago, and I'm STILL trying to fix this, I can't not write a review. 

I ordered 3 sandwiches. When my order arrived, there were only 2 sandwiches. I talked to the restaurant, they refunded me for the missing sandwich. Everything was cool. 

I just want to preface this next bit by saying I believe the fault is with Grubhub, not the restaurant. The restaurant manager did as much as she could to correct my order. However, I think there needs to be better Grubhub-restaurant training, because restaurants can say what they like about an order, but Grubhub won't necessarily honor the restaurant's word. 

We are a small, private, office, we order delivery lunch because we don't have a kitchen or nearby resources. After the first mishap with the sandwich, the restaurant manager called me back to tell me that if I placed the order again, she'll assign a Grubhub driver ASAP so the sole sandwich would be delivered to us as fast as possible. She then proceeded to tell me she would refund the entire order, as a courtesy. Now, before I placed the order, I mentioned that I would have to pay the delivery fee again, which I did not want to do. She ensured me she could refund everything. So I placed the order again. Fast forward to 3 hours later, 4 fights with Grubhub chat representatives, one incorrect refund, two missing receipts, a $5 bill that was sent with the sandwich from the restaurant (which I now have to drive back to return, because we don't handle cash at our company) and I'm just in awe at the effort it took to order some sandwiches. I also paid $5.43 MORE for two sandwiches in two transactions, than I would have by just not re-ordering that second sandwich. (Two sandwich total should have been $29.28, and I ended up paying $34.71)
author: Ashley H.

description: i love their eggplant sandwich with either dutch crunch or wheat bread. Another fav is the fish sandwich...reminds me of a filet o fish sandwich but with way healthier ingredients and taste so good!  I would choose Grubbin over Lou's sandwich any day!
author: Alyce l.

description:
Delicious, amazing sandwich with friendly service.

5 star for food

-1 for forgetting my hash browns!!!

+1 for being nice enough to boil some hot water for my Dad

5 star experience still
author: Edmond H.

description: I'm a San Francisco native and have always been a sandwich lover. I was skeptical about this new trendy place but the lovely Hannah reassured me that the sandwiches are delicious. Hannah was very helpful answered all my questions and had the best customer service skills that I've experienced in a long time. After taking my first bite of my sandwich she was right there delicious
author: Arianna A.

description:
Update 4/22

After my precious review, Victor from grubbing was nice enough to reach out to me and I was willing to give the location another chance as there was no hard feelings. 

I can happily say the sandwich was spot on. The Juicy was super yummy and done just right and customer service was on point. 

It is worth mentioning that when I came there were only two others in the restaurant which may obviously make it a bit easier then if it's during the slammed lunch hours. 

Overall I'm glad I gave this place a second look and was happy  with the taste and quality of the food and service. 

I'll be coming back and hoping it's always as spot on as it was today! 

Thanks Victor for convincing me to come back!
author: James C.

description: Excellent and a welcome presence in the otherwise bland and touristy area. Bartenders are really nice and fun. Food is fresh, high quality and SPICY!!!!
author: Anne S.

description:
Wowzz I didn't have much expectations for Grubbin' since I have been a fan of Lou's for years now. But this place serves pretty good sandwiches as well! +1 star for the yelp check-in bonus for free chips :) 

I got the Grubbin' ($10.61 w/ tax) on dutch crunch (ugh, best sandwich bread ever) and I was pleasantly surprised by its flavor!! As a meat lover, I got everything that I wanted in a sandwich. The sauce was pretty on point and it didn't make the bread soggy. Even though I did finish everything in one sitting, the portion was huge and I was so full afterwards. Def worth though
author: Emily L.

description: Super tasty, with a creative twist to the typical sandwich.
author: Rob K.

description:
Woohoo, toasty sammiches! Besides your regular ole' deli meat sandwiches, they also serve ones with chicken tenders, fish fillets, etc. They also use their own Grubbin' sauce/vinaigrette. 

Admittedly, I usually get the make-my-own sandwich with roast turkey (I'm a habitual eater, what can I say), and it's stacked high with fixings. They pop the sandwich in the toaster oven AFTER putting on the meat, so the meat slices are warm and slightly crispy at the edges. Hits the spot every time. 

Overall a solid, no-frills sandwich joint. Get a stamp card- buy 10, get 1 free :)
author: Samantha C.

description:
It pains me to write this review, but perhaps not as much as my current stomach pain from this place...

1. Really slow service. I waited over 30 minutes for 2 sandwiches to go.  At least three people who were served after me got their food first.  A couple who ordered after me got their food and were finishing eventhough I was still waiting on mine.  One customer got their orders mixed up and they had to remake hers, ended up getting a refund and a free sandwich, but hers were being made at the same time as mine... hm... 

2. It was a really beautiful day in SF. High 60s outside, but inside was 70 degrees plus. They had one large fan on the floor by the door blowing full blast, and one smaller wall fan, but that was nothing in comparison to at least 2 ovens, fryer, and what looked like no proper ventilation heating up the place.

3. When I got home, we tried the sandwiches, and they were in fact delicious. We gobbled it up and told each other we'll just call ahead for future orders to avoid the long wait...

4. Unfortunately, both of our stomachs within hours started growling and we were taking turns using the bathroom for what seemed like eternity. We've spent the hours trying to figure out what we both ate, and unfortunately the common denominator were the sandwiches.

Thinking back now, I do think the sandwiches could've been contaminated due to the much warmer temperature in the restaurant. I'm fully aware that the meat, sauces, etc. are kept in a cooler/temperature monitored stalls, but I recall seeing the middle prep table in the kitchen not refrigerated, and it was so warm inside, that the meat and the sauces could've easily gone bad...

It's really a darn shame, because despite the ridiculous long wait, and non existent customer service, the sandwiches were tasty at the time for me to say "we'll order ahead next time." I also saw one guy and one girl working hard making the sandwiches and I want the restaurant to be successful. However, it'll be a long while before our stomachs are brace enough to go through this again...
author: S Y.

description:
Not a huge fan of this place for some reason. I was excited to try it since it's close to home, and also a friend recommended it.

Arrived with parking right in front, awesome. We checked in and got the free potato chips. The bagged chips were actually really good - the Cape Cod style. Anyway onto the sandwiches - I ordered the Juicin', which had turkey, bacon, avacado, sprouts, provolone cheese, pesto aioli, and grub sauce....sounded great, but when I ate it, it fell short. Turkey was too bland of a meat to be placed with the ingredients. Or rather, the meat wasn't flavorful enough, so it just got drowned out. I was excited to get the Dutch Crunch roll that looks so amazing in everyone's pics. But it made the sandwich really sweet for some reason, which made the sandwich even more disappointing. My bf got the Droolin' (pastrami, salami, pepper jack cheese, spicy aioli, and grub sauce)....a little better since it was pastrami and salami meat, but also the same blandness. 

We also ordered Garlic Fries, and Tater tots, that also looked good in the pics. However, these were also very disappointing. The tater tots tasted like something you'd buy from safeway (not even trader joe's) and heat up in your oven.

Service -- not extremely friendly. Just got a vibe that the cashier didn't like working there. Also there's this Chinese lady they have cleaning up and bussing tables that can only speak Chinese - difficult to communicate with her. 

Disappointing...wanted to love, but couldn't. Also, the prices were expensive for the disappointing sandwich. It was at least 8-9 bucks per sandwich. To be honest, save yourself the disappointment and go to Yellow Submarine in the Inner Sunset for excellent sandwiches and excellent service!
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
The sandwiches are good but so over-rated. In essence, they are a typical sandwich you could get anywhere else except the bread has a good toasty quality to it and they are loaded with grub sauce.  

We ordered the Grubbin' It (Pastrami, Smoked Ham, Salami, Bacon, Sprouts, Cheddar Chesse, Pesto Aioli, and Grub Sauce) and the Juicin' (Turkey, Bacon, Avocado, Sprouts, Provolone Cheese, Pesto Aioli, and Grub Sauce). Once we FINALLY got them....took at least 20 minutes, they both started good (we enjoyed the Juicin more)  but after a few bites there was so much sauce on them, they just became soggy and overwhelming.  Wayyyy toooo much "grub sauce" aka mayo sauces on there.  

We may also have left with a bad taste in our mouth because one of the guys behind the counter was so rude..... Hey bud, I just paid you $20+ for two semi soggy sandwiches, the least you can do is not be rude to customers.
author: Michelle S.

description:
Favorite sandwich in the city! I always get the juicin and can't say enough good things about it. Great bread, toasted sandwich, tasty combo of ingredients.

Be aware if you're coming at lunch time during the week - a lot of students come from Lincoln high so it can be very crowded.
author: Maggie F.

description: Ordered the Juicin' on wheat roll. The sandwich was decent - had all the fixings, but the garlicky aioli overpowered the other ingredients. Also ordered a side of 6 grub wings, which were so-so. Pricey for what you get.
author: Chris Y.

description: Fantastic sandwiches for a great price. Their toasted sourdough bread is amazing. Big portions as well. French fries are a great side
author: Kevin S.

description:
Mouth watering toasty innovative SAMMICHES! ;)
My son said he didn't want a sandwich and I ordered up a turkey with swiss on Dutch Crunch and Avacado, the secret sauce and shredded lettuce with fresh veggies made it the bomb. We bought two more for home later and since my son has discovered the potatoes slices YUMMY!
author: Dianne A.

description: Nothing really special about this sandwich place. We got the chicken sandwich which comes in sweet and spicy. I got sweet and my friend got spicy. we didn't taste much of a difference so my friend got extra sauce.
author: Nikki H.

description:
If you are in a sandwich hunting mood, look no further as Grubbin has some of the best sandwiches in the city. 

A solid favorite has been the Grubbin sandwich especially on the warm and toasted Dutch crunch bread. The layers of meat are rationed perfectly and the spicy and pesto aioli compliment the bread, giving the whole sandwich a kick. Another plus is the size of the sandwich as it is enough to fill a person up. This is not the only sandwich on my favorite list as Grubbin offers an array of magical sandwich pairings that are tasty in every shape and form. Also, if none of the pairings fancy your taste buds, creating your own sandwich is another helpful and tasty option. I'll be a returning customer as long as I am in the Bay Area. Keep on grubbin!
author: Jessica E.

description:
An awesome place for a sandwich! Today was my day off from work, so I wanted to grab lunch in the area. Just the day prior I went to Lou's Cafe - which is 1 block from Grubbin - and really enjoyed it. These two are direct competition, so I wanted to see what Grubbin has to offer that Lou's does not. Honestly? It's very hard to tell. Both are great, but here's what I think.

The biggest advantage that Grubbin has off the bat is size of the sandwiches and price. The sandwiches were very big and only around $8. I ordered the Juicin' which comes with turkey, avocado, lettuce, sprouts and their sauce. I was very impressed by the flavor and loved that they put a good amount of avocado in mine. No doubt these guys know how to make a satisfying sandwich. I really liked the vibe in there too and it seems like a place that's meant as a hangout spot for the local schools around the area. All in all, you really can't go wrong with going here and grabbin' (grabbin, grubbin, get it?) a tasty meal. Well worth the wait.
author: Alex B.

description:
Came here today after rock climbing.  Small sandwich place.  Customer service was good.  Very friendly staff.

We ordered:
Droolin'-- with pastrami, salami, pepper jack cheese, spicy aioli and grub sauce in a whole grain wheat roll.  Came out fairly hot.  

Grubbin' It -- pastrami, smoked ham, salami, bacon, sprouts, cheddar cheese, pesto aioli and grub sauce in Dutch crunch 

Sweet mouth waterin'-- chicken tender, pepper jack cheese, honey mustard, ranch, and grub sauce in Dutch crunch. 

And side of Garlic grub fries!! 

What can I say? Every bite was delicious and so tasty! So flavorful!! The crunchiness and warmth of the bread make it even more delicious!  Prices are reasonable. 

We also ordered garlic fries and it came last since I ordered it last after the sandwiches order was placed.  It came hot and crispy.  Super garlicky-- just like how it's suppose to be  

We'll be back to try the other sandwiches in the future..
author: Junaline G.

description: This is one of my "must stops" whenever I visit family in the city. The dutch crunch bread is the best! So many great choices and all made fresh and delicious. Can't recommend this place highly enough!
author: Danielle Y.

description:
Oooooo....I can still taste my sandwich and it was GOOD. Mmmm....I feel so relaxed right now. These sandwiches pack a heavy punch so be ready.

So tasty and the sauce they put on the sandwiches are pungent. Oh man, the flavor is just so appetizing. I walking into this place you would think that the sandwiches would just be basic and your typically choices but they are NOT!!! They have all these different sandwiches that have flavor that explodes in your mouth as you eat. The result of eating a sandwich here is definitely a SIESTA! 

There is a TV here for watching sports events which is cool. There is limited seating so your best bet is to get your food to go. There are some cold soft drinks in their cooler. 

If you decide to eat here take the outside seating or sit on the stools near the window. Get some sun!!!

This place was a great choice for my dinner for sure. Just need me a cold brew and I am go to go. Maybe take yourself across the street to Dragon Lounge after getting a sandwich from here. Just don"t fall asleep there....they will mess with you and then most likely kick you out!!! HAHA

Grubbin....that is what I'm gonna be loving....oh yeah oh yeah!!! DEUCES
author: Robert F.

description:
i was really craving a sandwich and since lou's cafe was closed on a sunday, i decided to come here. i decided to build my own sandwich so i chose dutch crunch bread (my absolute favorite), turkey, avocado, pesto aioli, provolone cheese, grubbin' sauce, and all the other toppings minus tomatoes. it took about 7 minutes for my sandwich to come out. i was expecting my sandwich to be small but it was kind of big, so i was pretty content for paying $8.69 for a sandwich! 

after taking a bite into my sandwich, i was super satisfied! the avocado definitely hits the spot. i think if i added bacon to my sandwich, it would've made it taste even better haha. i would definitely come back here for the sandwiches!
author: Sylvia H.

description:
I only came here to try garlic fries as the gf was craving some. It was pretty disappointing.  For 6 dollars you get a small basket of fries with some reheated minced garlic and some dried parsley flakes. 

I can't say how the sandwiches are but stay away from this side.
author: William C.

description:
Good service and quick..the sandwiches were good and the grub sauce was good. Their fryer was broken so we couldn't try their most popular sandwiches. 
The sandwiches we ordered were tasty and they give you a great amount of meat and food although we have had better sandwiches in the city.
author: Susannah H.

description:
Looking for a small bite to eat while running errands at Odsy across the street, we tried Grubbin' and were very pleasantly surprised.
Great sandwiches with a creative twist, unique sauces and fresh bread. This little place stands apart from average sandwich joints without trying to be too hip.
author: Lars A.

description:
I love their sandwiches. I got the Juicin' and the Sweet Mouth Waterin'. Their sandwiches are really good! Juicin comes with bacon,  avocado, sprouts... I ordered it with Dutch crunch. It was delicious. Anything they fry is really crispy! Very important to me. 

Then comes the sweet mouth waterin... It's crispy chicken tender and sweet honey mustard sauce. So good....seriously, the crispiness is really important. It makes it that much better. Their sandwiches are so flavorful that they may have become my favorite sandwich joint in the city. 

I got chicken wings another day to go with aioli sauce. Also good! But kinda pricey for what you get. 

My goal is now to try everything on the menu.
author: Lyra C.

description:
What a gem. :)

Came here for lunch a few weeks ago with my boyfriend and we split a $9 Sweet Mouth Waterin' on Dutch Crunch bread, as well as $5 Grub Fries.  We picked this place because we originally wanted to try their Grubbin' Cheesy Tots, but it is no longer available (although it was still listed on their paper menu and website).

Regardless, the sandwich did not disappoint.  The Dutch Crunch bread tasted fresh and the fried chicken tender was crispy and delicious.  I only wish it were a little larger for the price, but I can also understand that running a small business in San Francisco is expensive.  The Grub Fries (garlic fries) were tasty, but did not blow me away as much as the sandwich did.

Overall, I would definitely come back, but I'm not sure I'll get to try any of their other sandwiches on account of liking the Sweet Mouth Waterin' so much.  The staff are very friendly and considerate; a woman offered us a second tray to make it easier to split our sandwich.  We used a Yelp check-in deal for a free bag of chips, and they let us grab any bag we wanted, even though there are two price tiers.  I'm glad we found this place!
author: Amanda W.

description:
Ooh damn,  the garlic fries (grub fries) here. So good and full of garlic. Ordered these babies togo and made sure to pop the lid in the car so they didn't get soggy. But then it wasnt hot-hot,  so I wonder if the fries were kind of sitting out for a bit? Still delicious though! 

Ordered two sandwiches, le boo got the classic Grubbin' with no tomatoes. I got Juicin'. Service was really nice and accommodating, they allowed me to sub the cheese and sauces in the sammy to make it my own. They also have a check-in offer too!  So go check-in and get a free bag of chips with your sandwich~

They toast your sandwich, unless told otherwise.  Let them do it.  Toasted Dutch crunch bread with all the fixings gave it that extra crunchy bite, got me feeling some sort of way. ^__^
author: Tina N.

description:
4.5 stars to be exact. 

Food: 4.0-4.5
-great selection of sandwiches. I tried "The Grubbin," which is on the top of their list and it was decent. The crispy dutch crunch roll and soft breading inside is what makes this place special from other sandwiches I've had. Bread, meat, and sauce ratio seems to be well calculated. Not too big or small for a lay person eating 45 plus sandwiches a year. 

Decor/Interior: 4.5-5.0
-modern without being pretentious. Layout is simple and customer friendly. There is a t.v that is on most of the time and some available seating outside. 

Service: 4.0-4.50
-friendly and nice. Staff always seem to be firing on all cylinders. 

Price: 4.0-4.50
-might be a little steep if you add on drinks and chips, but I think it's fair for city living.

Extras: 4.0-4.50 
-seems like a good place to relax and unwind for lunch, but I would definitely call in to order to go if I have business to take care of.
author: Phillip K.

description: Some of the best Dutch crunch bread I've found in the SF area. The service was fast and high quality ingredients too. I highly recommend the Kickin' sandwich!
author: Ben M.

description:
Great bread fresh ingredients!  Delicious sandwich! Great and efficient service!
Clean spotless interior!
author: Koichi D.

description:
SERVICE: The last time I was here I asked for a box to pack the rest of the tots and sandwich. The guy at the front offered to pack it for me! I imagine that most sandwich places will run a DIY type of business so this was a nice gesture in my eyes! Also, if you eat in, they're quite attentive to your needs and would also check in to see if you enjoyed your sandwich. 

FOOD: Fan-lickin'-tastic. for $8-10 a sandwich, the food here is a steal. The people of Grubbin' put a tasty spin on classic deli choices, like their Spicy Mouth Waterin', with spicy aioli, ranch and grubbin' sauce on a huge chicken tender. That's my favorite! Honestly any sandwich is a good option here. Don't forget your order of tater tots. You can get them 'cheesy' too, and when I say 'can', I mean 'must'. :) 

ATMOSPHERE: They have limited seating in this small spot but if you're not in a rush, take a seat. They have this huge TV running and on the last few occasions I was there, they were playing CSI. Nothing says "bomb-ass lunch" like a hot pastrami and pepper jack sandwich on a Dutch crunch roll while you're solving murders and assessing autopsies!
author: Greg Y.

description:
Grubbin'.... what a name!

You can never go wrong with trying a new sandwich place, and often times, sandwich shops have some unique creation that makes you coming back for more. My boyfriend and I have been meaning to try this place out, and quite frankly, we intended to go to Lou's Cafe that day. Instead, we discovered Lou's Cafe was closed so it was only fate to bring us to finally try out Grubbin'. 

My boyfriend and I ordered the Spicy Mouth Waterin' sandwich and chicken tenders & fries. I was disappointed when the guy taking our orders said that we could not add garlic fries..when we easily saw that they did via yelp! It wasn't a deal breaker and I just got regular fries instead. The chicken tenders and fries came out first and then the sandwich came much much later. I really enjoyed that they had a variety of dipping sauces for the chicken tenders. More importantly, I asked for more than one kind of sauce and I didn't get any weird stares from the workers or was charged additionally for them! They were kind enough to give me some without any hesitation. The sandwich was delicious and the sauce that was in the sandwich had a nice kick...it wasn't too spicy, and it wasn't too mild. I would love to try more of their sandwiches at this place!
author: Victoria K.

description: The sandwich is okay,  but the wait was ridiculous. When we came in 2 people where waiting for there food, no one in line. 5 people behind the counter, 3 was just talking to each other. So we didn't expect a wait at all. But we had to wait 25 minutes for 2 basic sandwiches!! During the time more people came to pick up, so they were probably more busy than they looked, but then they should have mentioned it when we ordered. I don't mind waiting for my food, but if I know I have to wait 25 minutes I might wanna go for a walk, or do my groceries in some stores close by.
author: Sisse L.

description:
I'm hungry and I'm NOT waiting for 45 minutes for a table at Kingdom of Dumpling. 

Jumped on Yelp and glad we did. 
Some of the best sandwiches I've ever had. Good food with complex flavors. Not just meat slapped on bread. My wife's veggie sandwich was fantastic. 

I'm going to be craving these...I just know it.
author: Ken R.

description:
Good neighborhood eats. 

Ordered the Droolin' and the Spicy Mayo Mouth Waterin' sandwiches. Great portion size and the bread has a beautifully light crunch. They offer pepperoncini, jalapenos and pickles at no additional cost. You have the option to build your own sandwich.

Also ordered the garlic fries which were a bit soggy and the chicken wings. You have your option of sauces to choose from to dip. Chicken wings were crunchy and moist. Options for 6, 9 or 12 pieces.

Total order was a smidge under $30.
author: Julie L.

description:
We were walking around on Taraval looking for this place, but apparently the numbering system is weird. That was a bit confusing. But! It was worth the find because the sandwiches were AMAZING! I came here with a group of 8 and at least 3 people (including me) said the sandwich they had here were the best they've ever had.  

Their menu has a lot of options, and you can even build your own! I got Droolin' with Dutch Crunch aka the best bread ever. The sandwich was filled with pastrami and salami, aka the perfect sandwich meat combo. It also had some sauces, and I added sprouts along with everything like lettuce tomato jalapenos etc but no mayo! It was delicious! The only downside is I had to wait about 15 minutes for my sandwich, and mostly everyone at the table already finished theirs. These sandwiches are so big, they fill you up very nicely. The place isn't very big, but there are some tables and countertop spaces.

If you're ever around the area craving sandwiches, this is definitely the place to go!
author: Andrea W.

description:
solid sandwich spot! 

I usually get the juicin' on Dutch crunch. the portion is healthy enough that I save the other half for lunch the next day. it definitely fills me up! 

the bread is nicely toasted and super crunchy! just the way I like it :) the turkey is juicy and tender and I love the bean sprouts in it 

if you're like me and bacon and cheese are negotiable, build your own sammy. it saves you almost two dollars and it's just as enjoyable. 

friendly staff and always welcoming. I'll be back soon!
author: Tina Y.

description: This is easily my favorite sandwich shop in San Francisco if not anywhere!! Everybody who works here is super friendly and the food and the wings are amazing!!
author: charles w.

description:
Came here because of the reviews and we were in the area. 

The store itself is very small with maybe only 5 tables. It was really hot and stuffy inside. You could see inside the kitchen area which was really messy and cluttered. I thought that was really weird. 

I ordered a sandwich with turkey and pineapple. The sandwich is very big. I could only eat half, but still good for its price. Other than that, nothing really specia
author: Susan L.

description:
Etymology
mouth + -gasm

Noun
mouthgasm (plural mouthgasms)

A sense of pleasure derived from eating food which tastes good
author: Jeff W.

description:
I had the Fishin sandwich today and it was great! Something different than an ordinary turkey or ham sandwich. Garlic fries is another $5. Unless you have a huge appetite, I would definitely recommend sharing this with a friend. The garlic fries weren't soggy like other reviews mentioned, but it wasn't anything spectacular either. I would come here if it was closer to public transportation. 

I'm not a local, but it seems like this place is near a high school. I came around 11:45 AM and by the time I started enjoying my lunch, over a dozen kids entered the place. It was hard to enjoy my lunch since I had to dodge their backpacks. This place is set up for a grab and go. There's only 2 tables and a few seats at the counter for customers to enjoy their meal. My boyfriend and I were lucky to snag a table before the crowd came in. But it didn't stop them from using the side of our table to squirt ketchup on their food. I understand this is a small place, but dude..be a little courteous. 

There's free 2 hour parking nearby but it can be tough during peak hours. 
Remember to check in for chips! 

Overall I took two stars down for speed and environment. My sandwich took over 15 minutes to prepare..and there was nobody there. High school students are loud, I get that. But don't invade another customer's table even though you are holding a bunch of food..
author: Danae L.

description:
Finally a good sandwich place not far from my house!!!!! Ike's, Lou's, Roxie's, and little luccas are all so far from my neighborhood.... Never want to fight for parking either haha. 

Came in late afternoon with my bf for both our first times here. I ordered the sweet mouth waterin which came with chicken tenders, grubbin sauce, honey mustard, ranch, and pepper jack cheese, and my bf ordered the grubbin. Also came with lettuce and tomatoes. We waited probably for ~10 minutes for our sandwiches, which is kinda longer than expected because there were only a few people in the shop other than us. However I do understand that they're still pretty new! We got our sandwiches to go to eat at home later. Oh and the sandwich also comes with a bag of chips. They had the standard Cheetos and lays, but they also had Hawaiian chips (woot Maui onion) and sun chips. 

When we got the sandwiches we were sooo happy to see that they were huuuugeee (we were starving)!!! Very comparable to the size of Ike's. Drove home and opened them to see that the bread was still in shape and not soggy at all, and my chicken tenders were still crispy!! Yay! I took my first bite and immediately tasted the sauces. The honey mustard and the grubbin sauce went so well together. I really enjoyed my sammy and I could barely finish it because of its size (buuuut I did). My bf really liked his too and said he thinks he might've found a new sandwich spot!

I definitely want to come back and try the other sandwiches! The one with pesto (I think juicin) sounds delicious so I will be back! :)
author: Tara A.

description: Definitely tasty sandwiches but I wouldn't go as far to say 'the best in SF". Everything was pretty tasty though so if you're in the area looking for a sandwich place, I'd suggest checking it out, otherwise I'm still on the hunt for something better than Ike's (if that exists). It was something about their signature sauce that didn't quite do it for me.
author: Anne G.

description: This place is sooo good. I ordered the kickin sandwich. Fast service. Great price and good people working here. I can't wait to come back. Highly recommend this place.
author: Nathan C.

description: Sandwiches are great! Service could be better... takes 25+ minutes for a sandwich. I don't know if it's the owners friend or what, but people are freely able to enter the area where the staff is making your food.
author: Y W.

description: One of my favorite go-to sandwich shops in the sunset district. Brought my girlfriend here for the first time and she absolutely loved the juicin' sandwich. The wings are excellent in terms of taste and zing. The grubbin'it sandwich is also one of my favorites as well. Good size sandwich for a good price. Took a little long to make the sandwich but worth the wait for a quality meal. Perfect for lunches and when you're going out with friends.
author: Austin H.

description:
I always pass by this place when I drive on Taraval but I never stopped by. This time, luckily I did! My friend and I walked in as we were walking our dogs since this was a pet friendly environment. My oh my, this is the place to start grubbin!! I ordered the Fishin' with sourdough bread which basically consists of a filet fish! Where do I even begin...My first bite, DELISH! The fish was crunchy and full of texture, even better with the touch of tartar sauce! The sandwich was also huge - a great portion that filled me up! I was barely able to finish! Definitely not skimping out on the ingredients. 

Great service too! Waited roughly 10-15 minutes for our sandwiches (not sure why it took this long for sandwiches but it was worth!). The dogs got doggy treats too! 

WILL COME BACK!
author: Eva C.

description:
In the words of Fergie, "T-t-t-tastay, tastay."

Grubbin' has a small but mighty menu. I feel confident you could order any of the sandwiches and be happy with them. I also feel confident you can split the sandwich with someone else and still be satisfied - the portions are moderate, but magically filling. The deliciousness density is very high. :)

Sandwiches are made-to-order, and have good-quality ingredients. It takes a minute, but it's worth it.

I'd love to see a couple more options, and being the health-concious asshole that I am I would love to see whole wheat/whole grain bread and maybe some variety in healthier beverages and sides (maybe seltzer, unsweetened tea, and baked chips or veggies).

I look forward to Grubbin' - and maybe going for a run afterwards - very soon.
author: Catie F.

description:
Finally got a chance to try this place. I went with my roommate and both of us got the "Juicin" sandwich.

This is the sandwich with most reviews. It was good and the sauces definitely made it an experience however for the size and cost. I wouldn't go often.

Total was 9.00 plus tax making it cost to $10

In my opinion if a sandwich is $10 it had better be large and have ludicrous amount of meat. However if your in the neighborhood and won't go anywhere else. I'd stop by and give it a try.
author: Nathan A.

description: I came in here with a friend for lunch and it seemed like a family run sandwich place.  The sandwiches we got were really good and the bread was delicious.  It's also close to home and affordable!
author: Jonathan W.

description:
We BE grubbin'....

Ok, ok...more like our breath BE humming from that creamylicious garlicky grub sauce. 

OTHER NOTES:
*Across from Dragon Lounge. Previously The Dog Pit: http://m.yelp.com/biz/the-dog-pit-san-francisco.
*Soft opened over the weekend. Regular business hours TBD and will update review accordingly.
*Menu has 7 signature sandwiches (1 vegetarian available); there's even one with fries. All sandwiches are $7-$9 or build your own for $6.
--Choice of Dutch Crunch, Sourdough Roll or Sliced Wheat. Get the Dutch Crunch.
--All sandwiches come with signature Grub sauce which is like a garlicky aioli. 
--Tastin' Veggie Sandwich ($8):  http://bit.ly/1hpAAma
*3 tables and counter seating.
*CC's accepted via Square.
author: Cherylynn N.

description: Went here for a late lunch when my friends and I were craving chicken tenders. They took a little while but we didn't mind waiting knowing that they were being made fresh. It's good price for A great meal. Only downside was that it was extremely hot inside but I'm sure that wouldn't be a problem on a normal cold SF day.
author: Kailee N.

description:
Grubbin! Finally, a new sandwich spot in the neighborhood! I came for the soft opening and so far, all went well. Thankfully, the menu wasn't overwhelming. They have 7-8 sandwich selections, some yummy appetizers, and plenty of chips and drinks to choose from. 

We ordered at the register and grabbed a seat. (They take cash/card. You can choose to dine in or take out.) Waited for about 5 mins for our order of the grubbin on Dutch crunch and grub fries. 

The grub sauce is to die for!! mMm... sandwich was huge and for $9, it's well worth it! Hubby and I split the sandwich and we both barely finished our halves. The meat in the sandwich was super tender and juicy, definitely not like regular deli meat. The bread was really fresh, as the veggies were as well. 

Grub fries were super hot and crispy... and super garlicky! Loved it! Will definitely try it with some grub sauce next time. 

Can't wait to come back and try more items on the menu! Hoping I'll have the option to toast/heat up the sandwich! I love when the cheese is nice and melted.
author: Ann T.

description: Great food, great prices and super nice people. I highly recommend eating at Grubbin'. Be hungry, because the food is not only great, but you get a lot of it!
author: Edward M.

description:
Atleast the LOCALS should know about this place.
Don't know what to eat? This is one of those spots to go to.
 This place is small but has a cool ambience. 
The sandwhiches will fill you up.  Big portion with a lot of flavor. TASTE BUDS WILL INTENSIFY.

You can create your own sandwhich  or pick their popular options also with variety  of delicious  side orders.
author: Jocelyn R.

description:
My boyfriend and I came to try this place and I got the Juicin', he got the Kickin', garlic fries, and two free bags of chips for checking in on Yelp! 

We really really liked this place. The people who worked there were so friendly, especially the cashier at the counter. (For my SLO friends, he totally reminded me of Thai Boat workers. Super down to earth friendly!) Anyway, our sandwiches were GOOD. boyfriend liked the wasabi mayo on his sandwich I think? And I loved the Pesto in mine. A little sad that I couldn't taste the grub sauce too much cuz the pesto is just overpowering (but whatchya gonna do, that's pesto!) Maybe next time I'll ask for extra grub sauce cuz I love lots of garlic. 

The garlic fries were super garlicy. Like the scent/taste stayed in my mouth throughout the day but I don't mind. The portion was perfect considering the price. We couldn't finish the whole thing even though we both only ate half a sandwich each. Probably best to split between 3-4 people. Bags of chips are like the mini ones of all the classics but let me point out that they have the Hawaiian chips and funyuns!! Just check in on yelp.. It's worth it! 

I would've given 5 stars but a couple things. It's not entirely their fault but by the end of our meal flies were in the way and wouldn't leave us alone since they leave the door open. We also asked for bags to put our leftover sandwiches and fries in but the guy at the counter said they could wrap everything up for us so we were like, aw nice!! Gave them everything including my half sandwich and a few bites of the first half. He asked if I wanted the small leftover piece too and I said yes please (I really did like my sandwich that much!!) However, they didn't give us back the fries (not sure if they got tossed or they just forgot to give them back to us packed up) and they threw away my eaten portion of the sandwich!! I was a bit upset but it won't keep me from coming here again. 

I honestly wanna give 5 stars but maybe next time. It's a great newer shop. Simple but it's got everything you could ask for. A few tables and chairs, a TV (if a Giants or Niners game is on, seems like they'd have it on TV), chips, drinks, and friendly staff. Will be here again soon and will tell all my friends. Thanks for opening closer to my home!!! No need to drive top far away for a good sandwich now!
author: Amanda L.

description: Three of us went over here the other day and we ordered 3 build your own sandwiches.  First, they got all of sandwiches right.  My wife ordered a veggie sandwich and my son a plain turkey sandwich.   They both liked their sandwiches. My son who's very picky gobbled his down.  I ordered a turkey sandwich with the grub sauce. Grub sauce is this aioli like sauce.  The garlic in the sauce was good and wasn't overpowering.  If you like garlic I would recommend the grub sauce.  The only reason this wasn't a perfect experience was the fact that we were waited on right away.  I only found out until after we ordered that the reason why was b/c there was a huge order being placed over the phone and they had a new person in training.  If they simply just acknowledged us and told us they were busy at the moment I would totally understand.  Overall, if in the area and are craving a sandwich I would highly recommend this place.  If you're looking for something different and want a little kick in your sandwich try the grub sauce.
author: Mike S.

description: Love love love the sandwiches here. It's a super small shop. They only have like 2 tables and 8 chairs probably. Ordering is simple. You walk in, menu is on the chalkboard, order and hopefully grab a seat. I shared the grubbin and the sweet mouth waterin, both ordered with everything and on Dutch crunch. I usually get Dutch crunch for every sandwich I order anywhere, but there's something about the bread here that's different. It's toasted perfectly with a crunch exterior and a fluffy interior. I'm not sure if it's the toaster they use or what, but I want in. The meats in the grubbin were sliced thinly to my liking and tasted super fresh! And the chicken tenders in the sweet mouth waterin was the perfect amount of juicy. Not dry at all! But of course the winner was the grub sauce! It completes the sandwich! Oh they also give out stamp cards. Get one and make it worth your while.
author: Jennalyn L.

description:
I had high expectations before trying Grubbin', but I think they were a little too high. Grubbin' is a small, quaint sandwich shop, pretty close and comparable to Lou's Cafe, serving specialty sandwiches ranging from $8-$9 or build your own starting at $6.49. They also offer sides of fries, tater tots, buffalo wings, and chicken tenders. 

I ordered Grubbin' It - pastrami, smoked ham, salami, bacon, sprouts, cheddar cheese, pesto aioli, and grub sauce on Dutch crunch bread. I was expecting a huge, mouth-watering sandwich, but it did not meet expectations. First, just by looking at it, it didn't look spectacular. Then, it tasted just as it looked...good, but not spectacular. As far as the meat, I mostly tasted the ham, which is my least favorite of all the meat in the Grubbin' It. I barely tasted the bacon, which was the reason I chose to order it over the Droolin' (but it was in there, I checked). I hardly tasted the pastrami and cheddar cheese in the sandwich. The Dutch crunch bread was a little off as well. I wouldn't say it was stale, but it really did not have that delicious, sweet taste that fresh Dutch crunch usually has. The grub sauce was dripping out of the sandwich, making it very soggy and messy to eat. Overall, it was still a good sandwich, it just wasn't mind-blowing. People hyped it up too much. 

What I did like about my experience...it's a cute, little shop with great concept, name, and logo. The staff was very friendly, they made my sandwich in very reasonable time, and they offered a free bag of chips with Yelp check-in. I also like that they offer stamp cards for loyal customers. The size of their sandwich could definitely feed one hungry person or two semi-hungry people. Although I wasn't crazy about the Grubbin' It, I wouldn't mind trying a different sandwich some day.
author: Jean S.

description: BOMB sandwich! Second time here and I've only had "Juicin'"! So dam good! The melted cheese and their secret sauce is delish. My new go to place when in the area.
author: Monica R.

description: It was okay, seemed like an average sandwich but was a little more on the pricey side. I was trying to eat a little healthy which maybe doesn't fit this type of place. My wife got a less healthy sandwich that had melted cheese on it and it was better than mine. It is on the way to GG Park which is cool to pick up and have a picnic. But I wasn't blown away so for the price I'll look for another spot on the way to the Park.
author: Wayne S.

description:
Its like your family-friendly neighborhood convenience store at the corner of the street. Grubbin' is non-descript. One look at the place, and one might considering continuing down the street, but as it is said, one must never judge a book by its cover. This is especially true for Grubbin'. It's meant to be a carry out with minimal seating and a space that cuts down on the overhead. 

The Yelp reviews make it clear. There is no dissenting when it comes to the food. The menu is fun, and all the delicious choices are hard to choose from -- a good problem to have. 

I got a carry-out order of crunchin' and juicin' and was impressive by the sheer weigh of the bag I received. Always promising when you get what feels like a sizable amount of food! Juicing' was my favorite, but I'm a sucker for turkey sandwiches. 

The bread of course is the main star here. Man, that Dutch Crunch. Yum. You won't be disappointed with the Dutch crunch and any of the menu options. Its crunchy but not too crunchy and the bread is air soft. A great mouthfeel on the bite.

Definitely bookmarked on my Yelp, and definitely will continue to visit whenever I'm around that neck of the woods.
author: Enoch W.

description:
Best sandwich spot in the sunset. I rejoice the day Grubbin' opened, and have since then tried everything on the menu. Nothing disappoints, but my two favorites are the Grubbin' and Juicin' (and Droolin'...).

Thank you, Grubbin' fam, for the amazing eats and great service!
author: pauline joy r.

description: Was in the mood for Ike's but saw this place and thought I'd give it a try. Definitely not disappointed with the "Super Mouth Watering" chicken tea series sandwich I got! Parking is easy, they're super nice, and you get a free bag of chips with a check in.
author: Danielle B.

description:
Hands down THE best sandwich spot I've encountered in my entire 16yr SF experience (this place is giving Ike's a run for their money - without the obnoxious wait!)

GET THE CRAVIN' SANDWICH ON DUTCH CRUNCH WITH JALAPEÑOS (YES, DIET BE DAMNED).

Clean, simple, affordable, DELICIOUS.

Maybe now it won't be as tough to convince my friends to hike "ALLLLLLL the way to the Sunset" to hang out...?

Baby steps.
author: Anjali V.
