description: I love the blend of flavors on the Grubbin' It sandwich so much I can never seem to convince myself to try something else.
author: Marina G.

description: Great food at decent prices! A must visit for sandwiches in the city. They have fresh ingredients but the bread really makes the sandwiches here!
author: Tyler L.

description: A phenomenal sandwich spot. I have tried a few of the fried chicken sandwiches here. All of which have left me fully and very happy. They really know how to pack in those flavors. Big thumbs up
author: Andrew N.

description: Grubbin' has quite a lot to work against in this neighborhood like Lou's and Deli King. What makes them stand apart is their unique twist on naming their sandwiches, use of sprouts (which I really appreciate), and their amazing sides! I have never had a bad sandwich from Grubbin', but I have yet to try everything. This time around, my intended sandwich, Fishin', was not available, so I went with the Droolin' (Pastrami and Salami), which can't go wrong and it was awesome! Don't know exactly what's in the Grub sauce, but it makes a difference! I figure it's like how Lou's has their sauce, Grubbin' has their Grub sauce. Either way, Grubbin' is a great option for anyone craving a great sandwich!
author: Jeremy L.

description:
My family and I, stopped at this place for lunch and we weren't disappointed at all. Grubbin was clean, friendly staff and great food. I'll definitely come back when I come back to town. Love it!
Thanks you guys!
author: Monica M.

description: This spot has probably the best sandwiches in town , fuck Ike's, fuck Lou's and definitely fuck subway. This spot has em beat.
author: Wilson H.

description: Small sandwich shop that is conveniently located. Ordered the Droolin' and Savorin' sandwiches. The Savorin' was good, but the winner of the two was the Drooin'. Portions are good, and everything tasted very fresh. I did wait a long time for the sandwich, as there were 3 folks ahead of me. Maybe I will call in next time first. They are very close to Lou's cafe, so if you want a change from Lou, check Grubbin out.
author: A L.

description:
I've been making Grubbin my go to place now. I think the Check-In chips is enough to make me come here over Lou's. To be honest, I don't know which is better, but I do like free chips. ;) 

Anyways, I used to always get the Juicin' because I love avocado, but then the Spicy Mouth Waterin' is the bomb . Chicken tenders in a sandwich? Genius. I love it. The Grubbin sauce is fantastic and the Spicy Aioli... Yum. 

I've also come here like 10+ times but I always forget the stamp card. Unfortunately, they don't ask you if you have one or not, so it's easy to miss out on stamps. 

I also think the garlic fries portion is too small for the price. I always get it to go so it comes in the small plastic container. 

Sandwiches take 10-15 minutes, so call ahead of time!
author: Brandon L.

description: Great flavors. Plenty of options. Fresh bread, fresh meats and fresh produce. All ingredients to make up some great sandwiches. The tots are cooked to ordered and are great with some garlic added.
author: Kyler B.

description: Great sandwiches and amazing service with a smile! Not your everyday sandwich give them try you won't be disappointed
author: Vanessa V.

description:
Wow

I really just stumbled in here because i had to run errands in the city, I got the droolin' sandwich and grub fries and i gotta say..

Sandwich was pretty damn good, perfectly toasted and just the right amount of dressing. The garlic fries were the definition of what good garlic fries are, a good amount of roasted garlic in each bite, not just a bs amount of garlic and tossed around to spread the flavor.

Keep it up fam
author: Anthony K.

description: Favorite sandwich shop ever!!! Their grub sauce is amazing and their Dutch crunch bread is delicious I go here almost every time I'm in SF
author: Kristine B.

description: This place is good for hot sandwiches with lots of meat and sauces. The spicy mouth waterin had crispy chicken but the bread was a little thick for our liking. I had the grubbin it and while good, it was a little salty. The cheese tots lacked flavor but you can request grub sauce, thousand island, buffalo sauce, spicy aioli to dip.
author: Sheena N.

description:
DROOL
So if you're ever craving garlic fries, like, fries WITH YOUR GARLIC (there's a butt ton of garlic, probably didn't get my joke. :P) then this is DEFINITELY the place to go! The garlic fries are the best I've ever had. I always order Juicin', love me some turkey and avocado sandwich. But I can never finished a sandwich AND the fries, firstworldproblems. D: 
Damn it.... now I'm craving some Grubbin'.
author: Stephanie Z.

description: Five stars for the Tastin' sandwich, which ranks among the best vegetarian sandwiches I've had in SF.
author: Preethi K.

description: Good prices and great food. The service was fast and very friendly. Found this place by Yelp after leaving the zoo. It got pretty busy around 4pm but the food is worth the wait. Also if you check in then you get a free bag of chips with a sandwich purchase.
author: Lacey M.

description: Dutch bread makes the sandwhiches soooo tasty.
author: Don C.

description: I was craving a sandwich in the area and found this place on Yelp! If you check in, you get a free small bag of chips too! ;) I don't think this is on the menu but there was a hand written poster recommending the "Cravin'". It has ham, lettuce, pineapples and a special sauce I think. I got it on Dutch crunch and it was amazing! Would definitely recommend! I also ordered the tater tots and the garlic fries and shared everything between two people. The tater tots were really crunchy and fried to perfection :) the garlic fries were very garlicky. Personally, I thought it was a good amount of garlic, however it was a bit oily and not fried well enough so it was a bit limp/soggy. Lol. I would like to try other sandwiches next time and the cheesy tots as well. I would definitely come back! The service is great as well. It has only three tables I believe and some bar space so there's not much seating there and it took a bit for all our food to come. However, they were really friendly and thoughtful while they brought our orders to the table. They asked if we needed an extra tray since we were sharing and also helped us box our food and assured us that our food would be coming right up. Would definitely recommend this place :)
author: Bailey L.

description:
Friendly, simple, with a spunky menu - that's how I like my sandwich shops! 
You can anticipate a wait during prime times.
This place also offers free self-serving water, and free chips upon check-in via Yelp - can't beat that. 
Anyway I'm gonna eat my droolin' sandwich now. *Shaun out*
author: Shaun D.

description:
Grubbin' offers generously-portioned sandwiches, each with a witty name, such as grubbin', juicin', and droolin'. But nothin' about the sandwiches names are tellin' you which ingredients are actually in it, so you'll need to read the menu in more detail.

While in the neighborhood and before Lou's opened one block west, we stopped by Grubbin' to see what they had to offer. It was a warm Sunday afternoon and they were quite busy, so they unfortunately ran out of dutch crunch AND sourdough rolls!

I settled for the Droolin' (pastrami, salami, pepper jack cheese, spicy aioli, and house grub sauce) on a french roll. The french roll was okay, soft and fluffy but lacked any crispness. The pastrami tasted very processed and was unmemorable. Yes, a lot of deli meat contains many additives, ie: nitrates and nitrites, but something about their pastrami just didn't sit right with me.

Service was nice, and since sandwiches are toasted, the prep time was roughly 7-10 minutes. Sandwiches are quite large and meat portions are generous. You also get a free bag of chips with a yelp checkin. Overall, Grubbin' offers a great value, but I found my sandwich to be forgettable. Unfortunately, the chances I'll return to Grubbin' to satisfy my sandwich craving, while in the neighborhood, is unlikely.
author: Priscilla W.

description: The sandwich really blew me away. I know that sounds like an overstatement, but it was packed with flavor! I had ordered the Juicin' on a French roll and had added pepperoncini's! I like that you can customize your sandwich different ways even their signature sandwiches. The service was really friendly and I liked that they gave a free bag of chips for checking in. If you can't finish the sandwich they'll even wrap the rest for you to take home! Great job guys!
author: Jose O.

description: There were a lot of sandwiches shop opened on Taraval and I want to try them all. The reason I picked to try Grubbin' first because I was attracted by the hot garlic fries. I ordered the Juicin sandwiches. They have a lot big chunks of turkey ham inside. The sandwiches tasted delicious. The fried chicken wings was hot, crispy and yummy. Staffs works quickly, too. However, I took once star away cuz they kept the door open in a cold weather and wind blows inside the shop towards me. Definitely will try again in the future.
author: Katherine L.

description:
My boyfriend and I decided to go here, after we went to the zoo.  The cashier was nice, but she had to make a number of substitutions, after we had already paid and put in our order, SINCE THEY RAN OUT OF BREAD AND FRIES?  They only had enough fries for a small order instead of a large, and they said they ran out of all their bread, except for one for sandwiches.  We were fine with the bread, but for the fries, they substituted the lack of fries with tator tots, which we agreed to.  The sandwiches were fine, although a bit pricey.  Also, the tator tots and fries were okay, we saw they came in a frozen package and were cooked in a microwave.  

After we had eaten and left, my boyfriend and I felt very ill.  We are not sure what item of food it was, but we are pretty sure it's from here.  We probably won't go back, unless general improvements are made.
author: Crissy C.

description:
A surprisingly delicious sandwich shop!  We stopped in here after reading all the other great Yelp! Reviews and were not disappointed :). The crispy chicken tenders sandwich on crunchy Dutch bread is so good it'll keep you going back for more.  If you're not a sandwich person, (nor am I) don't be deterred!  This place shouldn't be categorized as a sandwich shop, but in a brand new meal category due to the yummy warmth of the sandwich, the crunchiness of the bread, the real meat fillings, and the fresh veggies inside.  

Grubbin' thanks for caring so much about sandwiches and for your delicious creations.   Great value and deeelicious melty warm hug in your mouth sandwiches.  If you're in the hood, and have a hankering for fried chicken (and wouldn't mind eating it in a sandwich), or a good fish sandwich...Go!
author: Vanessa C.

description:
Ordered their Droolin! Very delicious. 
They're always busy, so if you don't want to wait, it's best to call in your order ahead of time. Definitely going back for more
author: Nate S.

description: First time eating here and I must say it truly lives up to it's name. The most "grubbin" sandwich I've had in like forever. I recommend this place to everyone!
author: Sha R.

description: The food here was excellent, everyone in our party agreed. Possibly the best sandwiches... ever! The restaurant itself was very cute but small and plain, and for our group of six slightly ill-fitting. Overall though, truly a treasure of Yelp!
author: Maya M.

description:
Sandwiches are screaming delicious.  Now if they could add the potato salad from the submarine sandwich place on west portal.....they would reach nirvana. ;-)

Order the 'Grubbin'....it's a home run.
author: Sharine d.

description:
Goood very good sandwichs. Obviously you can get better sandwiches at clancys or elsewheee but it's an above average sandwich, cheap, and fast. Solid 4 stars. I'll be back.
Side portions are a little skimpy but they're good. They have rewards as well. Worth checking out
author: Nick J.

description: Loved our sandwiches! Got the juicin and droolin. Dutch crunch bread is delicious and crunchy and sandwich was packed with meat. Definitely worth a visit.
author: yuri k.

description: I got the cruchin' (vegetarian) sandwich without cheddar cheese, it was ok. I couldn't taste their grub sauce. Comparing this place to Lou's, I prefer Lou's sandwich. Grubbin' sandwich is about the same size as Lou's. Price is about the same. Menu wise, Lou's have more varieties. Overall to me this place is ok, nothing really special.
author: May H.

description: My boyfriend and I had the grubbin it and the juicin and both were really good (get it on Dutch crunch!). I was kind of turned off by sprouts in my sandwich but surprisingly I didn't mind them and actually ended up liking it! We also ordered the bacon cheese tots that were pretty bomb too. If your in the mood for a sandwich and in the sunset area I would highly recommend it. In my opinion I don't think it beats Ike's tho.
author: Linz C.

description:
My favorite sandwich in SF!

I've had both the spicy mouth waterin' and the lickin' which span both chicken and pastrami in terms blog base meat.  Both were amazing.

The grubbin' sauce is super flavorful and the Dutch Crunch roll hit the optimum point on the crunchy-soft continuum.  (See my other review about Sandwich Spot for more detail on how Dutch Crunch should taste)

Long wait times during the busy periods.  We were told 25 min when ordering today, but we decided to go for it anyway bc the sandwiches are that good.
author: Sebastian N.

description: This place rocks!!!...Went back today, and picked up 3 sando's for the family...This place knows how to create some screaming combos!!!...Check this place out!...I gotta swim a few laps !!!...Yeeees!!!
author: Brian C.

description: Totally love this place! After fishing or biking around Lake Merced, my family has been here a few times. Absolutely delicious sandwich combos. I've tried the Juicin' and Grubbin' both on their amazing Dutch Crunch bread. Picture attached is from my visit last week, of the Grubbin' sandwich. So. Delicious. Grubbin has become a must-go whenever we visit family in San Francisco.
author: Danielle Y.

description:
Delicious sandwiches especially a win out here in the Sunset district. A bit pricey but the sandwiches are definitely loaded. House sauce is excellent. 
The staff is a bit dull/lacking personality. It doesn't really look like they're enjoying their job which influences my experience of the food, for sure.
author: Maja J.

description: AMAZING!!!! I got the sweet mouth waterin' sandwich and added bacon & avocado! to die for! must try! excellent customer service!
author: Emily O.

description: Stumbled in here randomly and absolutely starving. Holy shit. Hit a god damn homerun. A new favorite.
author: Dan W.

description:
Delicious sandwiches and awesome people :)

Love their Dutch crunch turkey sandwich. Everything is very soft and yummy here!
author: ABC Z.

description: Great food! Quick service. Nearby high school students flock here. Defiantly worth a visit.
author: Mack H.

description:
Five stars all the wayyyyy!!! Great addition to the neighborhood, abundant street parking and nice guys making good food. Had the Spicy Mouth Waterin' and would definitely order again. So large I had 1/2 to take home!

What makes Grubbin better than your ordinary sandwich spot is their signature sauces. A great depth of flavor stacked high, in between bakery fresh bread. All sandwiches are layered with the freshest ingredients: crisp veggies, meats prepared per order and scrumptious sauces. Sandwiches aren't overly sauced either - Just the right amount. OH! And they melt the cheese too! Thank you! I love that!!

Nice variety of chips and fries. The cheesy tator tots were surprisingly delicious. Everything is hand crafted with care. So happy this place opened. Will be back to try the veggie sandwich and wings soon.
author: Rosalyn W.

description:
We were on the way to the zoo and needed a place to grab a quick bite to eat.. Yelp led us here.

They seemed a little overwhelmed with the number of people there and it took a while to get our sandwiches.

Having said that.. The sandwiches were worth the wait. Both the husband and I got the eggplant sandwich and it was delicious and the bread was super fresh.

-1 star for getting garlic fries when we didn't order it and when we told them that they shrugged and said its on the ticket. I wished they were just a little bit more attentive in taking the order and how they handled the situation!
author: Anitha C.

description:
Best sandwich shop I've ever been to by far! I am a huge sandwhich person, especially in love with Dutch crunch and they definately made it to the top of my list. 

Very good customer service and in a convenient location. 

Definately coming back!!
author: Jessica S.

description:
Grubbin ... I swear  wrote a 4-5 star review for you guys but I'm not sure what happened to it. Anyways, my last 2 experiences have given me mixed feelings.

Ordered on many occasions: Juicin, Fishin, corn dog, tater tots, Grubbin Cheesy Tots

Dine in experience:
1. Juicin - this sandwich is huge. it's a sandwich you need to share. Flavors are all there and the sprouts are a nice touch to the sandwich. This is actually my favorite. I'll even sub in the wheat bread.

2. Fishin - big sandwich as well, pretty much same big sizes as all the others. Fish patties are huge and so damn good.

3. side of tater tots - perfectly crispy and not greasy/oily. Tastes so good with some of that aoli. 

4. Grubbin Cheesy tots - wayyyyyy too salty. There is just salt overload and I had to drink a lot of water. The cheese is just really salty + all that bacon. it was like ... DAMN.


TO-GO experience:
on 2 separate occasions ordering to go for a Juicin and Fishin ... Both sandwiches seems to lack in size compared to dining in. 

it almost felt like the sandwiches are made smaller because they were to-go. The Fishin' barely had any fish. The fish patties were lacking any fish meat. The Juicin seemed to be lacking meat as well. 


I've always had a great dine-in experience when eating here but the 2 to-go experiences have been disappointing. I'll stick to eating - in next time I want a sandwich and see how it goes.
author: Kenny L.

description:
Came here on a Sunday afternoon around 3PM. Parking was no problemo! 

I ordered the Spicy Mouth Waterin' sandwich on sourdough. I wish they had sliced sourdough, but they only had sliced white bread. The sandwich lasted me 2 full meals. it was amazing. I asked for no mayo because it comes with Aioli, which is essentially mayo.

The chicken was cooked perfectly. I also noticed they slice their own deli meats here, which i completely appreciate. They have water cups for free water and also a fridge of your regularly offered drinks.

The service was superb! overly friendly and genuinely caring about our happiness.

One issue is that my boyfriend ordered his sandwich without cheese and sprouts. It came with cheese and sprouts. they immediately recreated for him and apologized profusely. hey, it happens :)

The restaurant seats about 10 people, so if you have a big group, get it to go and eat at a park or home.
author: Kailey O.

description: Loved this hole in the wall. Workers are very friendly and look forward to coming back!
author: Ty M.

description:
I already super like Grubbin'.

First of all,
I gotta say
there's something really nice
about having a sandwich shop of this caliber
so relatively close by my place.

Second,
they fashion a sando
that I would consider
a rare mix of
old school mom and pop portions
with new school flavors like pesto aioli.

But
more importantly:
did I really find myself grubbing?
was my sando really that juicy?
(Juicin':
Turkey, Bacon, Avocado, Sprouts, Provolone Cheese, Pesto Aioli, and Grub Sauce)

hell yeah to both.

Sufficed to say
I will hella be Grubbin'
for many days to come.
author: Dan B.

description:
Love the sandwiches here! You get free chips when you check on Yelp - highly recommend the Hawaiian kettle chips. We ordered the Droolin' sandwich today and split it for a light lunch....so so good! Ordered it on the Dutch crunch bread which was the perfect sandwich bread - crusty outside and soft inside. 

If you are looking for a flavorful lunch for less than 10 dollars that will fill you up, then I highly recommend this place.
author: Vasu M.

description: Ever since I bought a bike I have been riding out to neighborhoods of SF that I never would have ventured to.  This weekend's adventures brought me to the Parkside neighborhood.  After biking about 10 miles the fiancé and I were starving; a quick yelp search for some veg friendly sandwiches brought us to Grubbin'.  A tiny little café with a large menu of sandwich combos as well as wings, fries and juice/soda.  We both grabbed the 'tastin' sandwich.  I modified mine to be vegan (no cheese, no mayo, no grubbing sauce) and added some spicy mustard with a side of BBQ chips (free with Yelp check-in!).  Each sandwich has your choice of bread (sourdough, dutch crunch, wheat, sliced bread) and standard fixins' (onions, peppers, lettuce, tomato).  I went for the classic SF sourdough and it did not disappoint! This bad boy was massive.  The perfectly toasted and crunchy sourdough bread was perfect with the roasted eggplant, sprouts and avocado inside.  At $8.50 this meal was a steal.  I was full for hours after finishing this beast of a sandwich.  Not too heavy or greasy like Ike's, Grubbin' sandwiches are filling but with fresh ingredients and great service.  Would highly recommend coming here if you're in the area.
author: Kelsey B.

description:
Grubbin' is a sammie shop ala Ike's with named specialty sammies. or u can build ur own (6.49+). place has no atmosphere, just a prep counter and cashier counter.

eats: Grubbin' it(9)
*"pastrami, smoked ham, salami, bacon,  sprouts, cheddar cheese, pesto aioli, grub sauce" with the usual lettuce, tomato, red onions, mayo.
-tasted just ordinary, no wow. expecting too much?
-sammie kind of big, not skimpy (just skimpy on taste)
-doughy and mayo aftertastes
-free chips.

crumbs:
-friendly, fast service.
author: Victor G.

description:
Average sandwiches - frankly no different than any other sandwich place in SF. Would give it three stars if not for the ridiculous conversation we had trying to order to go on a weekend since we were close by.

If ordering one of their signature sandwiches be prepared for a soggy drippy mess unless eaten immediately. Even then the second half will be drenched by the time you get to it. With that in mind we asked for a modification and ended up going somewhere else entirely as a result.

Our last attempt at eating there we were surprised to find out that they either cannot or will not put their grub sauce on the side. They "make it in the sandwich" whatever the xxxx that means. We will never know since the guy on the phone did not care to explain and we do not care to return.
author: Easwud C.

description:
Grubbin' is exactly that.  It's a tiny casual sandwich joint inside with little room to dine in.  I called my order in and picked it up seamlessly.

Do a Yelp check-in and you get a free bag of chips as a one time offer.  I got the Juicin' sandwich which is turkey, avocado, lettuce, tomato, mayonnaise and some alfalfa sprouts.  I chose to have these ingredients wedged between a hunky piece of sourdough.  The sandwich is pretty hefty- more than a 6 inch.  I had to take a break and come back to it.  It's more gourmet than a Subway sandwich, and you can even build your own.

I can't wait to grub at Grubbin' again soon!
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
Came here for lunch with a couple friends since there were not that many choices to eat around the Taraval area. Stopped by here since they had pretty good reviews on Yelp. I was not disappointed.

I ordered the Grubbin sandwich which consisted of a mixture of meats and veg. The sandwiches are pretty big explaining their prices. The bread was nice and crunchy and the flavors were on point. 

I will definitely recommend! Try to come early or later if you want a seat since the place is very small.
author: Arda S.

description:
Ok, I just have to come right out and say it - Grubbin's sandwiches are..grubbin.'

D and I each ordered a sandwich, when, really, we would likely have been fine with just one.  Didn't help that we had a $5 order of Grubbin' (garlic) Fries, either.  Wish the fries had been hotter (even though we ordered to go, I snuck a few fries in the car. They were plentiful of garlic - yum! - but just warm) and should have asked for extra spicy aioli and/or Grub sauce for dippin.'  We preferred my $8 Droolin' to D's $8 Savorin,' but both were tasty.  Loved all the standard fixings - lettuce, tomato, red onion, mayo - and the free extras - pickles, pepperocinis, and jalapeños, but the sauces really made the sandwiches.

Expect a bit of a wait, since everything is made (and toasted to order).  Grand opening special gets you a free canned beverage or bag of chips with sandwich purchase.  Tim's Kettle Chips?  Don't mind if I do, thank you very much!
author: Mel T.

description:
Get the 'grubbin it' or 'juicin it' for the full food coma effect. haha! But yeah, best sandwiches  on the block! Customer service is 10/10 too. Got the homie Brandon who knows how to make a fat sandwich that would definitely put you straight to sleep. (He would be the only dark-skinned filipino worker there) haha show some love with a friendly tip. 

Definitely recommend to place an order over the phone. You would probably need to wait a while if you order at the store, thats why. And when you get there, don't forget to check-in on yelp to get a FREE bag of chips!
author: Darrell N.

description: Got the grubbin it sandwich. Best thing I've eaten in San Francisco! Bread was amazing, pesto aioli was delicious and the meat was just the right amount. Excellent sandwich
author: Paul M.

description: Just ate here. Must say, one of the greatest sandwiches I've had. Yes, it's not an Ike's, but it's straight "Grubbin'" I didn't know about this place until my roommate told me about it and asked if I wanted to do, so I said yeah, why not! Right as we enter the place, an amazing smell welcomes us in. As we started ordering, the workers helped us switch out things we didn't want, add things that were their favorites and at the end, the sandwich was perfect.
author: Yash P.

description:
There's Ike's and Lou's.  Now there's Grubbin'.  These places offer sandwiches unlike ones you may make at home.  Or maybe it's just me.  Two slices of bread with ham, salami, or bologna with mayo.   Sometimes mustard.

Nowadays designer sandwiches come with special sauces.  And loads of other dressings.  Jalapeño spread, peperoncini peppers, house special sauce,etc.

Grubbin' is now officially open. This is the first week so canned soda free with your sandwich order.  Three tables of four, and counter with seven stools.  

We walked up two blocks from home.  They opened at 11am.  Hours posted on the window,  M-F 11am to 7pm and Sat/Sun 11am-6pm.  

Paper menu on the counter.  You can order a designed sandwich or build your own.  We ordered three sandwiches to go.  Bread is toasted unless otherwise specified.  We waited about 15 minutes.  

They also offer student lunch special as the local high school is two blocks up.

The sammies are good size. About 8 inches long and heavy.  I was full after eating 1/2 but forced myself to eat most of the second half. 

Grubbin' is a great addition to the neighborhood.
author: Shirley N.

description:
It was a Sunday and we were in the mood to try something new. Don't get me wrong, our usual sandwich spot - Submarine Center in West Portal has never let us down. The fast service and top quality sub sandwiches are always something we can rely on.
However, time to branch out and do some exploring. Who knows, we might find a hidden another hidden gem. JACKPOT! Grubbin' on Taraval/24th Avenue, is a place that was hidden off our radar, but now stuck out like Sutro tower on a foggy day. The service was great and the sandwiches are tasty as well. Super fresh bread (we had the dutch crunch and it was perfect) mixed with awesome meat/cheese/sauce combinations that are too many to remember.
I had the "Droolin'", which was pastrami and salami, two of my favorites. That sandwich didn't have a chance and it was down the hatch in no time. My wife had a roast beef and our daughter had a salami sandwich, both of which were tasty as well.
We live in the nearby area so Grubbin' is up on our list a slight tick behind Submarine Center, only because Submarine Center are super fast in making the sandwiches. Those guys are an established go to place and it shows. However, I think the parking situation for Grubbin' is easier. At Gubbin' you can take your sandwich and enjoy outside at McCoppin Square on the next block.
Thanks Grubbin', we will definitely we grubbin' again soon!
author: Mark M.

description:
Here is to another one of my very rare reviews. Felt compelled to comment on the quality of the sandwiches as well as customer service. 

I ordered the spicy crispy chicken sandwich, juicin, and the hot wings to-go. The quality of the bread was on point. I had the Dutch crunch and French roll. I am now actually wondering if they bake their own bread. 

I asked for all the sauces on the side bc I am so particular about textures and didn't want the sandwich to arrive soaked and soggy. To my amazement the crispy chicken sandwich was still  crispy and fresh! The grubbin sauce was great! The juicin came with a delicious pesto, as well. 

The honorable mention goes to the hot wings. It's rare to have crispity crunchy wings in a to go order. The crispness was perfect and the batter was not heavy at all. I'll definitely be back! 

Thank you for putting all my sauces on the side :)
author: Jessica L.

description:
I'm excited that there is a great sandwich spot close to my work. My favorite sandwich is the grubbin and its huge! I ask for extra sauce with mine and usually get an order of fries on the side too. 

Sometimes I call ahead and place an order with them if I only have a short lunch break.   The girls working there are very nice. Very accommodating of them!
author: Kendall L.

description:
One of the better sandwich joints in the sunset, Grubbin' has a solid menu that'll satisfy many different kinds of palettes and diets. Aside from sandwiches, the restaurant also serves root beer floats and hot dogs--though I haven't tried either of them myself. 

The prices--usually around $7-9 for a sandwich--are a little high considering that you're basically paying for two pieces of bread and some meat, but the portions are generous and you can easily turn one sandwich into two meals.

You can choose from one of the specials on the menu or build your own out of a sizeable list of ingredients. This isn't Ike's, but you'll be able to make a variety of different sandwiches from the available options. 

The place isn't too big, so if you have a large party with you it might be best to just take your sandwich and go to the park across the street. There's a small selection of drinks and sides, but the sandwiches are really this place's specialty. If you're passing through the neighborhood on the way to the beach, or coming back from a morning at the zoo, it's not a bad spot to drop in for a bite.
author: Amanda R.

description:
Just came in for a sandwich with my two friends. I ordered first and knew something was off when they got their sandwiches before me. 15 minutes after they got theirs mine finally came. I know stuff happens, people forget or get mixed up, I work at a tea shop so I get it. However, they didn't even acknowledge it. No thank you for waiting, sorry it took so long, just gave it to me after 5 people who ordered after got theirs first. 

The food was $16. Sandwich was $9. $7 for cheese fries? For real? There was bacon on it too, which I didn't ask for. I'll take my business to Lou's instead.
author: Shira S.

description: Just tried the garlic parmesan chicken wings - unfortunately they were soggy, small and overpriced.  I don't think I'll be coming back.
author: Ernest S.

description:
This place is one of those mom and pops place.  Pretty clean inside,  but has no ac. I was excited to try the cheesy tots but the fryer is broken,  :( another day I guess. 

Droolin 3.5: pastrami, salami, pepper jack cheese, grub sauce, garlic aioli, jalapenos, pepercinis, I chose the dutch crunch bread, only way to eat a sandwich.  The sandwhich also comes with a small bag of chips (lays bbq, cheetos, sun chips, fritos) and a bloe pop! The sandwhich is supposed to come with fries inside but the fryer is broken. I totally forgot,  could've gotten the same sandwich for $2 less by building own sandwhich. The sandwhich was great,  nice crunchy bread,  tender pastrami and good sauce (chipotle like), but it was small,  this the 3.5 stars, and the no fries.
author: Thuy N.

description: Stopped by SF for a quick meal as we were driving down south. The staff were kind enough to stay open a little bit longer to serve us, as we came in as they were closing. Luckily we were planning on take the sandwiches to go. I ended up getting the savorin' with everything with the dutch bread and my gf got the juicin' with the french bread . Both were really good. The juicin' had a refreshing and clean taste to it. The savorin' had a good flavor and the sauces weren't overpowering. Besides the taste, the sandwiches were a good size and a reasonable prize. Would definitely grub again.
author: Samer M.

description:
Amazing spot to pick up a quick lunch. I would recommend calling ahead and ordering if you don't like waiting. 

We ordered the Spicy Mouth Waterin Sandwich on Dutch Crunch bread. The sauce and the bread really make this choice amazing. 

The only thing that's keeping this from 5 stars were the tater tots, they were a little soggy.
author: Devin L.

description: Came here to grab a bite to eat before the Warriors game. My friend recommended it. My sandwich was amazing! It was a chicken tender sandwich with honey mustard on sourdough bread. Very well put together (I hate sandwiches that are thrown together. Like "One shit storm coming right up! Here ya go!" Not the case with this place fortunately) and very filling. Excellent and prompt service as well. Thank you, Grubbin'! My go-to sandwich spot for wherever I'm in The Sunset from now on.
author: Tati N.

description:
Whoa, how did I miss this place?? So good, generous portions of meat, cheese, and veggies. Friendly staff, clean and new dining room. Carefully prepared, perfectly toasted sub.

I thought Lou's was the automatic choice on Taraval. Finally noticed this spot last week and gave it a try. A serious rival has emerged. Like Lou's, the menu is well thought-out and each sandwich is unique instead of offering just the typical options with cute names and loads of sauces that get everywhere (i.e. Ike's.) The sandwich artists take their time in layering the ingredients within the confines of the bread and wrap the sandwich twice with paper. 

This place is quickly rising to #1 on my personal SF sandwich list.

The good overwhelmingly outweighs the bad at this place. Highly recommend!
author: Patrick H.

description: If only you were in Boston... Grubbin' was a wonderful treat during a quick stop in SF. We ordered the Spicy Mouth Waterin' with a side of Grub Fries (garlic fries). After a recent disappointment in the garlic fry department (oil instead of fresh garlic), I was instantly pleased when we were served our heaping tray of piping hot fries tossed with fresh garlic. The sandwich was made on Dutch Crunch bread which is my new all-time favorite. The chicken was crispy and finished with a delicious combination of spicy aioli, ranch, and grub sauce. I'd highly recommend this spot considering it was the first time in a while where I was able to find that perfect balance of spice and crunch with fresh ingredients. A must if you're in the area!
author: Erika B.

description:
This place is yummy. I like anything with pastrami. The garlic spread is really good.

Theres also a big TV where I saw the seahawks get rekt.

Parking is easy, Mccoppin and Lincoln High have lots of spaces
author: John R.

description: Came to this part of town because Craftea was closing. :(. However, since the line was hella long I decided not to go, I'm sorry, but I just couldn't deal with that line. :\. It was good and all, but not that good. SOOO, decided to grab a sandwich here to try it out! Thanks for accommodating my order even though you guys were closing up soon! Ended up getting the Juicin': turkey, bacon, avocado, sprouts, provolone cheese, pesto aioli, and grub sauce all on a dutch crunch roll. MY KIND OF SANDWICH. I got it to go and didn't end up eating it until like 30 mins later, but damn that was still pretty good. :D. A bit soggy, but like I said, I ate it much later. I'm sure it would have been better fresh. All in all, a solid sandwich spot--plus they have stamp cards! Yeeee. I'll definitely be back if I'm in the area. ;D. So many other great looking combinations there. :] Thumbs up, grubbin'!
author: Mariel A.

description:
I'm not a big sandwich person, but when I tried Grubbin', I was happily surprised. 

Very yummy turkey sandwich and great service. 

New spot that is definitely worth trying!
author: Irina R.

description: Good sandwich but soooooo NOT worth the wait at all. 3 people making sandwiches literally one at a time, 1 person taking orders, and 1-3 people standing around. 45 minutes from ordering to handing me the order.
author: Carol P.

description: Amazing service. Fast and easy orders. In n out. Just like that. Awesome food. Free chips with check in. Super close to the zoo...
author: Tj P.

description:
-awesome service, yes I know it's a sandwich spot...but they really do all the little things that make the BIG difference! they're considerate about take out packaging, being mindful of what's being ordered and how it can stay yummier for longer :)

-their sammies are bomb.com, but DON'T forget about the tots! and chicken tenders. DELICIOUS. I'm a tater tot connoisseur and these tots...perfectly crisp, flavored and not oily.

-their spicy aioli - in their sandwiches/dipping sauce. These guys know how to make it spicy! I hate it when places call their sauces "spicy" and its not... spicy.... not the case here :)

So glad I found this spot!! Always know I'll get something delicious. Big portions - good bang for the buck!
author: Selina W.

description:
Wow! This place totally saved the day!

After trying to get food at several other restaurants in the area that were closing early or closed for New Year's Eve, we drove by Grubbin', parked and had some of the greatest sandwiches in a long time! 

The garlic fries were delicious, between three of us we had three different sandwiches and all very satisfied, even taking almost one full sandwich home for leftovers. 

Highly recommend this spot, amazing bread, but they ran out when we were there so go early and you will enjoy whatever you order!!
author: Liz B.

description: This update is long overdue.  I came back to Grubbin'  last month and ordered the Spicy Mouth Waterin'.  This sandwich comes with chicken tenders, spicy aioli, ranch, and grub sauce.  Per the name, you would think the sandwich is spicy, but it's not.  I wish there was more of a kick from the spicy aioli, but the added jalapenos and pepperoncinis definitely helped. The flavors combined made the sandwich very tasty and I liked that the chicken was moist.
author: Candice H.

description:
SF is filled with great sandwich spots, to the point where no sandwich really makes me swoon anymore. However, life's really all about the little things, and Grubbin' does them perfectly well. I'm a self declared sauce boss and have been since I was a kid, and Grubbin' offers a plethora of sauces. If you're a glutton who shamelessly asks for a ridiculous number of sauces on your sandwich, then Grubbin' is for you.

Also, it helps that the sandwich is huge, bread is perfectly toasted, meat is above average quality, and contents of the sandwich are very generous. If you order any of the chicken sandwiches, the chicken is perfectly toasted; too often have I received chicken sandwiches where the breading is some weird loose soggy foreskin. 

The staff has a great attitude and are very accommodating. Well worth the slightly above average price of $10 a sandwich.
author: Douglas Y.

description:
I always come here when I'm craving a really good sandwich but don't want to try and go to Ike's. It's THAT good. I usually get the spicy mouth waterin' with everything on it. I have yet to try anything else because I'm always so satisfied with that sandwich that I have no reason to try anything else! It's definitely one of the best sandwich spots in the Sunset/Parkside area!

The workers are also very friendly (they probably recognize me by now) and they always play good stuff on the TV. Just avoid the restaurant during lunch time on weekdays unless you want to deal with all the high school YOUTHS. (They're alright, I'm just old and cranky).
author: Gregg H.

description:
My first yelp review ! I have been wanting to try this place since it showed up on my yelp search. I went for the first time this week and got a couple sandwiches. 

Tastin' : it's their veggie sandwich and I got it on Dutch crunch plus jalapeños. Let me just say they do not skimp on the eggplant. I thought all the sauces tasted nicely balanced but the sandwich got soggy quickly so eat quickly. 

Also tried the Juicin' : this one had turkey, bacon, and all the veggies piled high. Also got this one on Dutch crunch. Their serving of turkey is very generous and this sandwich was very good overall.  

Lastly, even though the sandwiches are great, I gotta take a star off for the wait. It took me about 15 mins to get my sandwiches after I ordered.

Will definitely come back again. Especially since their fryer was down so I couldn't try their chicken tender sandwiches.
author: Celia Z.

description: This place is pretty solid. The food is a little greasy, but at a place called Grubbin', you'd be hard-pressed to expect anything other than that. If you've had the garlic fries at AT&T, then you can't really compare, but they give a generous topping of chopped garlic on top of your thin-cut fries for $5. Again, super greasy, so be aware. The sandwiches are bomb. Their special spread is fatty and delicious, and if you know what you're doing, you're going with dutch crunch, bacon, and avocado. After that, you can't go wrong. Portions are huge, and a make-your-own sandwich starts at $6.50. Their specialties go for $8/9. Friendly people and large portions. Can't go wrong. You also get a free small bag of chips for checking in and buying a sandwich. What. The interior is small, so I would say get your stuff to go and enjoy the park next door with some milk tea.
author: Danny C.

description: The bread was REALLY REALLY hard. I almost couldn't bite through it. Other than that, it was a pretty good sandwich. The sandwich took pretty long to make though. Probably because they were toasting the bread.
author: Yeah O.

description:
This is my new favorite place for a few miles around. Bomb sandwich. Period.

And free chips with Yelp checkin
author: Gaurav A.

description:
Wanted to try this place out since they said it was similar to Ike's. It was okay compared to Ike's. It wasn't bad, but I kept comparing it to Ike's and Ike's sauces and sandwiches are so unique and spectacular.

I got the Droolin' (Pastrami, Salami, Pepper Jack Cheese, Spicy Aioli, and Grub Sauce). It was $8 - which wasn't too bad and it came with a bag of chips. It wasn't spicy and the sauce was really thin - it kept dripping out. I got Dutch Crunch for my bread, it was really soft - I loved it! I think if the sauce had been better - more flavorful/spicy - it would have been good. 

The service was a bit slow since it was just the two of us and another couple. I think it took them at least 15 mins to make our sandwiches. 

I'm down to try this place again because the sandwich wasn't bad and the location is much better compared to Ike's.
author: Annie H.

description:
LOVE the sandwiches at this place! the bread is not overpowering at all and the sprouts make the sandwich taste earthy and delicious :) Its a homey little place and I love their customer service. 
I work down the street and they did get my order wrong once so I called them back and they were apologetic about it. I even asked if they could deliver it to my workplace (my boss wouldn't let me leave again to get the sandwich) and they delivered it right over quickly :) 
One of my go to places to grab a delicious sandwich on my workdays :)
author: Nancy W.

description:
this place is an absolute gem on taraval. my experience was fast, efficient, and very easy, just the way i like it to be!

on a saturday morning around 11, i called in for a Juicin' sandwich for pickup. i had to call several times before anyone picked up the phone. i assumed they were busy and don't have call waiting, and voila! i connected with someone on the third phone call. the guy on the phone was very friendly, and the order was quick and painless. he informed me that my sandwich would be ready for pickup in about twenty minutes.

went and picked up my sandwich exactly twenty minutes later, and it was wrapped and ready to go! total came out to be around $11, which i think was pretty good considering the size and contents of the sandwich (turkey, bacon, avocado, sprouts, provolone cheese pesto aioli, and grub sauce). the dutch crunch was the perfect level of crunch as well. personally, i could only eat half of the sandwich, and would recommend it to be very share-able, but i could also see a very hungry person eating the whole thing. i would definitely go back again :) 

check in on yelp for a free bag  of chips with your sandwich! there are also lollipops by the cash register for your taking. oh, and grubbin offers stamp cards, buy ten sandwiches and get one free!
author: Caitlin C.

description:
I don't like leaving negative reviews unless the people are lying jerks, so I'll keep my comments short and maybe even give them a do-over. 

My sandwich wasn't grubbin. It was soggy. And they can use a spring cleaning day. 

Ok...that's all. Gonna head up the street to Lou's Cafe now.
author: Justin H.

description:
Like a true Yelper is was feeling for a sandwich while wasting time out in the sunset and found this place and like their name sake it is HELLA Grubbin!! 
I had the Jucin' and I was very impressed.
Turkey bacon avocado are the main ingredients matches with an aioli sauce and some type of Grubbin sauce. 
I usually only eat half and sandwich and eat the other half an hour or two later but this was sooooo good I ate it all. 
I can't wait to be back in that area so I can try another one of their amazing sandwiches.
author: Blake R.

description: Modest looking sandwich shop, but boy do they have flavorful sandwiches. I don't particularly crave sandwiches unless they're done well with healthy ingredients that compliment each other and leave me wanting it again soon. This place did just that to me. I had it twice in one week. Tastin' is eggplant, avocado, Brussels sprouts, and a sauce I can't get over. They recommended dutch crunch bread which is sweet on the outside - one of the best breads I've had. I will likely become a regular here!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
I'm not one for sandwiches but Grubbin' has got me re-revisiting the my decision to give up on carbs. 

We ordered the "Lickin'" but it happened to be out. I guess that makes sense since it's probably their most popular. We settled for the "droolin'" and I have to say, true to it's name, I'm still salivating after I've finished the giant monstrosity that they call a sandwich. And a delicious sandwich it was, the bread was soft and fluffy, lightly buttered and toasted just so that each bite was met with a nice KRUNCH. It was a perfect blend of spicy aioli sauce, grub sauce, pastrami, and salami in every bite. The chopped lettuce and fresh onion gave the sandwich another nice crunchy fresh layer. It was a sandwich of perfect harmony.

We also ordered a side of garlic fries which, as it turned out, was unnecessary. Maybe we were just full from the sandwich, but we didn't finish much of the fries. Also, it tastes a bit stale.

All in all, still great place to be, especially on a Sunday afternoon with the Giants game on the big screen.
author: Lu G.

description: Great sandwiches. Finger licking good! We tried veg crunchin and chicken.
author: Meera S.

description: Delicious and dog friendly! These sandwiches are huge and amazing. I had the Juicin' and loved every bite. It is easily enough for two meals. Although the sandwich is ginormous, make room for the tater tots. They are perfectly fried (not oily or mushy) and come out hot and yummy!
author: Andra K.

description:
This place is the ish... Reminds me of when I was in high school and went to the near by sandwich spot with all my friends. The guys are nice. Always attentive. 

Tried the spicy mouth waterin', for the first time cause of a co worker and I was in sandwich heaven, even my son loved it.  

The wings and fries are sooo good. Thank you sandwich gods for this spot near my job. I will most definitely come back and recommend you guys to all the customers asking what's good to eat around 15th Ave.
author: Geenaa L.

description: Easily one of the best sandwiches I've tasted in my time visiting SF. I came here with my friend before we went sightseeing for the day, and we were both amazed. We shared the Grubbin' It, and I was glad we did because the sandwiches here are huge! They are not so large where it doesn't satisfy, but it's juuuuuusssttt satisfying enough to make you content. The sandwich was warm and the cheese was melted perfectly.
author: Jessica L.

description: Wow wow wow!!! Hands down favorite Sandwich place at the moment. Fries are crisped to perfection. Don't forget to order Garlic. I ordered a Juicy with everything on it and the first bite was ammmmazeballs. Then I bit into my boyfriends Spicy Mouth Watering (with Avocado, Bacon, switched the chicken to turkey) and it was even tastier than mine. I will be ordering the Spicy Mouth Watering next time.
author: Margarita M.

description: Extremely good sandwiches! My boyfriend and I came here to compare it with Little Lucca's sandwiches. Although they aren't as big, they are made warm and crispy whereas at Little Lucca's it's served cold, but a huge portion. Great environment as well. The workers are really nice and plus they're Warrior fans!! I would definitely return!
author: Michelle H.

description:
I come here every couple months. The sandwiches are delicious. Juicin' is probably my favorite. The Dutch crunch is amazing.  The sauces are good. 

Unfortunately, I am taking off two stars because I have waited 25 min for my sandwiches the last two times I have been here. 

TLDR: foods good, wait is ridic
author: Wilson M.

description:
I usually don't give 5 stars but I've been here four times and every time, I've enjoyed my delicious sandwich and my overall experience.

I build my own sandwich: dutch crunch with turkey, grub sauce, spicy aioli and everything included. The sandwich is perfectly warm and bread is nice and toasty. It's a pretty bulky sandwich - I usually save the other half for later. 

The workers are super friendly and they really strive for above and beyond customer service. This has been my go-to spot for a good yummy sandwich. 

Not to mention, a free bag of chips when you check in on Yelp! So worth it.
author: Aimee W.

description: Solid sandwich for sure.  Cool peeps running the place.  Not a worldbending chicken sando, but there's a fierce chicken sando game going in SF and Oakland so its tough.  Solid and if I'm in the neighborhood would return
author: Christian S.

description:
I work in South City and the place - despite it's moderate amount of food options - is a food desert. Everything eventually starts to taste the same. I went out of my comfort zone to go to Marco Polo for Ice cream, saw this across the street. While I had to battle for a spot in the line with a few high school grade school kids, I was utterly shocked at the selection that they had. I went for their Sweet Grubbin' Sandwich. The sandwich's sauces were to die for and the fact that they fried their chicken prior to putting it on the bun is what made the sandwich shine. 

I really like this place. I'll be coming back here, again. I like it a lot, the seating options here is the only reason I knock off one star.

Keep up the good work!
author: Jane E.

description: I love the spicy mouth waterin. I try to stop here every time I'm in town. Just thinking about it makes the mouth water, in fact.
author: Amber J.

description: My boyfriend and I were visiting SF and wanted to grab a quick bite before we head to the beach. They were super helpful and informative. The answered any questions we had. The sandwiches were delicious. I wish I remembered what I ordered! Definitely would come back next time I visit!
author: Lily L.

description: We stopped by here while in the city for a basketball tournament. It was a little out of the way but well worth the trip. The service was excellent and the food was not only delicious but fresh. Definitely a spot we'll come back to.
author: T P.

description:
LOVE THE SANDWICHES!!!

For it's price, they come in HUGE sizes. I swear to you, I feel so filled after the first half of the sandwich. 

Furthermore, they are VERY dog friendly. They have a bowl of water with tables outside AND they have dog treats.
author: Christi A.

description:
If I didn't have to do 1000 crunches after eating a Dutch Crunch sandwich, I'd come here every day. Okay... that's a lie. Every other day! This is such a good sandwich spot to satisfy your satiety while keeping your wallet full. 

I didn't get the special sandwiches; tried the make-your-own grub instead, and... I guess I have a pretty good idea of what to put in my sandwiches. Or it may also be the fact that they pack in your fillings extra large and extra tight. So generous for a huge $7.00 sandwich! Try their special sauce as well for an extra kick and for 1st timers, check in for some free chips :)

The 1000 crunches might even be worth the 20 minutes of Dutch Crunch heaven...
author: Mandy C.

description:
Best sandwiches in the sunset. Doesn't cost an arm and leg either.

They give you a choice of bread along with the sandwich, also ask for jalapeños to give your sandwich a kick.

Items on the menu are all less than ten dollars

Sandwiches may be a bit salty for some, they're all a bit heavy in flavor.
author: Mia M.

description: First time. Amazing! Everything I want in a sandwich shop. I ordered the Spicy Mouth Waterin' on Dutch Crunch and small fries. Both were incredible! Great bread that was so warm and toasty. Fries were perfectly cooked to my liking, no mushy ones. Grub sauce is great. I am stuffed! Can't wait to try something else. Friendly staff too. What a gem in the Sunset!
author: John H.

description: Delish. Savorin', Juicin', Sweet mouth waterin', garlic fries, and cheesy tots- tried it all. The Dutch bread was our favorite. Prices good,  not dirt cheap but worth it.
author: Gina M.

description:
Sandwiches r really good here. Grubbin sauce is grubbin!
There's even chicken tenders, corn dogs , tater tots and fries for the kiddos. 
Friendly staff!
author: Grace T.

description: My chicken sandwich was piping hot and tasted great. Not a lot of seating but luckily we were the only ones there. Prices arent too bad.
author: Jeff E.

description: The sandwiches here are super yummy! A great place to get some delicious sandwiches if you're near by. Highly recommend it (:
author: Rachel H.

description: Came here randomly to get something to eat, had no expectation to what the sandwiches would taste like, chose the veggie option, Tastin. Waited for about 10-15 mins and then got my sandwich. After the first bite I was surprised by how good it was. It wasn't too saucy, plain, or overwhelming in flavors. It was perfect. I couldn't stop biting into it until it was all gone. Great spot! Will definitely come again!
author: Josephine L.

description:
Really good sandwiches. I ordered the Droolin' ... and I was literally droolin'.

The only reason it's not a 5 star is because the wait for the sandwiches was a bit long. My friend and I ordered 3 sandwiches with maybe 2 people in front of us and it took over 20 minutes to get our order.
author: Chrisy Y.

description:
They DO Fried Chicken Sandwich Right.
I wanted to get the thing for a long time and I finally got it.
And it was Awesome, Spectacular, Fantastic, you name it. 
I mean OMFG, Shit, I crap my pants like good shit!
I got the chicken tender sandwich w/ everything on it.  
The chicken was really juicy and the signature Grub sauce was great w/ a big nicely toasted Dutch Crunch roll. 
Made my day!
Thank you Grubbin', I'll be back.
author: Nobu K.

description: First place we came as far as food in San Francisco during our visit and it was sooo good! My husband and I both did the make your own sandwich with crusty bread(can't remember exactly what they called it) with the Grubbin sauce... This place got our SF visit to a great start, Thank you guys!
author: Anna K.

description: They did it....they made their dutch crunch just perfectly crunchy and toasty.  5 stars.....go here its freakin delicious
author: Vince L.

description: I appreciate when customers like myself come in a little before closing after a long day at work and the workers who have probably also had a long day don't push you out of the store.  With that being said, I love a good deli sandwich.  So I come in and look at their menu and decide to try the Juicin - turkey, bacon, avocado, sprouts on dutch crunch.  I thought it was going to be pretty standard, but I was wrong.  It was totally Yum.  I don't know if it was the sauce they used or what.  The turkey and veggies seemed really fresh.  The price was reasonable, the service was great, and the food was good.  No complaints here :)
author: Christine D.

description: This is the go-to place!! Their sauce is so good, not too expensive, and a great atmosphere. Park on the hilly slope and parking is free! This is the place you want to go for a quick sandwich - they have something for everyone. I can't emphasize this enough: no one I've brought here has had a remotely bad experience. Keep up the good work, grubbin'
author: Sean H.

description: Their sandwiches are good, but they have super slow service!  There is no reason to wait 30 min for 2 sandwiches at 2:30pm, with 4 people working there.  They even had to turn away customers at one point because they told them it would be a 25 minute wait.  Totally ridiculous.  Get your act together!!!
author: G W.

description: This is my DEFAULT spot for Sandwiches in Sunset.  The sandwiches are yummy and the toasted Dutch Crunch is a must.  Introduced this sandwich spot to my coworkers and now they come here pretty often.  We even do lunch orders here for some of our meetings.  This is definitely one of the better sandwich cafes in SF. This place can get pretty busy so order ahead of time to avoid the long wait!
author: Denise C.

description:
Grubbin is as good as its name would imply. They have great signature sandwiches, (you can also build your own). They are easily My fav sandwich spot in the neighborhood. I'd be hard pressed to think of many that are much better anywhere though. Definitely worth a stop if you're in the area. 

They give you free chips with check in, they used to be free all the time, but alas now I have to press two buttons to get my chips. No worries though cuz I like letting others know about not so hidden gems like this one. Try it some time, I'm sure you'll like it.

CHAD
author: Chad L.

description: Any place that serves tater tots is a winner in my book. And the sandwiches are great.
author: Tommy A.

description: Great stop!  Thanks YELP for not steering us wrong.   The sandwiches are fantastic and the service was great.  Portions were quite generous.  I'd highly recommend this place!
author: Craig D.

description: Had the Droolin' sandwich. Excellent french bread, and thin sliced meat. Would recommend to friends.
author: John C.

description: Saw good reviews on Yelp so I decided to stop by and SO glad I did. I got the Tastin' sandwich on the Dutch crunch bread and I really enjoyed it. You can make your own sandwich if you want too which is cool too. I think which ever sand which you choose you will enjoy. Its a very mellow place which looks family owned. Overall really good I ate half and saved the other half for later !
author: Cynthia R.

description: Just happened to be working this morning got a sudden crave for sandwiches so I looked for the nearest place around me and saw that this place was about to open in a few minutes so I park my car and walk to store I get greeted by the employee who is very nice and chill dude but they ran out of fries but then he offers the check in yelp deal and I get free chips so I ordered the grubbin it sandwich and my god this shit blew my god damn mouth away, so many juicy meats going on at once and their sauce is like the blood of Christ himself, this shit is so amazing that I want to stick my dick in it and have babies with it. the bread has an amazing crunch to it and shit man I'm still eating the sandwich as I'm writing this review. Even though I don't come to sf often to work, but on the days that I do I'll definitely be coming here to get my sandwich fix.
author: Johnny M.

description:
Not a very good spot for vegetarians and especially not vegans.  The service was spotty although they were fairly nice.

The only issue was that they wanted to charge me extra for ordering a vegan sandwich...  They actually tried to charge me for EXTRA MEAT price on my two vegan sandwiches that had less ingredients than any of their listed sandwiches.  I had to do the math in my head and ask them about it until they reluctantly gave me the normal price.  I felt like it was a little ridiculous to make your guests catch errors in your ordering system and still fight them on it.  They made me and my girlfriend feel completely unwanted in their little sandwich shop and did not put our needs first.  I could tell they thought we were crazy because we didn't want meat, cheese, or their gross sauce.  As a business owner in San Francisco, this attitude only makes you look stupid and hurts your wallet, not ours.  

The actual sandwich we got was really bad.  The eggplant was bland and had an off taste/texture.  They don't know how to cook, they just throw the stuff you had in a college cafeteria in between some bread and splash sauce on it.  Ugh....  BORING.

For the money you spend here you get a really bad sandwich that is trying too hard to be hip.  There are so many great deli's in the city that don't charge $8 for a sandwich or $4 for a handful frozen tater tots.
author: William G.

description: This place is amazing!!! Thank you friends for bringing us here. ps please open a location back in Orange County pleaseeee!! Ohhhh and we're taking a sandwich for the road :-)
author: Maria A.

description: Best sandwiches of my entire life omg Love the juicin' *emoji heart eyes*
author: Diana C.

description:
Everyone I take here likes the sandwiches.

I really like Juicin' which as turkey avocado and sprouts. It is close to $10 so it's one of the more expensive sandwiches. Now I usually opt to "build my own" and get turkey with pesto aioli - it tastes similar to Juicin' but it's only $7 I think.
author: Derek M.

description:
Grubbin replaced the hotdog place that used to be here. The restaurant layout reminds pretty much the same.

== Food ==

There's a wide variety of sandwiches with pretty interesting names.

Grubbin' It on dutch crunch was pretty awesome. This sandwich comes with pastrami, smoked ham, salami, bacon, sprouts, cheddar chesse, pesto aioli, and grub sauce. It's one greasy sandwich, but it tasted good. The sandwiches are toasted with the meat.

== Service ==

The sandwiches come out pretty slow. Probably a 10 minute wait for it to be done.

== Overall ==

Good sandwich place at good prices.
author: Steven B.

description: Good food, great menu, pice is good, place is clean and staff are friendly. Sandwich makers need hair covers.
author: Judy A.

description: When you first walk up to this place, all you can smell is savory goodness. I can't even explain what it is exactly. It's like they're making sandwich magic inside. I ordered the grubbin for my husband and I had the turkey provolone. Mine was good but I took one bite out of the grubbin and instantly knew why this sandwich was named after the restaurant. I don't even like pastrami that much and this was da bomb dot com forward slash grubbin. Make sure all of your sandwiches come with the grubbin sauce and their Dutch crunch is as crunchy as can be! Soooo good!!
author: Tiffany H.

description:
Good sandwich places are hard to come by. I mean, in SF alone, there's probably hundreds of sandwich shops, deli markets, and cafes that offers sandwiches on their menu. 

Buuuuuuuuuuut, Grubbin' definitely deserves a spot towards the top of your list. Their selection of sammies doesn't trail on and on, but what they have to offer is already enough. Seriously, if you look at their menu, you can see that most of their sandwiches have a variety of 2-3 different kinds of meat (ranging from pastrami, roast beef, chicken tenders, ham, salami, turkey, or bacon). Alrighttttt and now you're thinking they probably skimp on their meat since they can't really include all that meat in one sandwich. WELLLL THEN. Let Grubbin' surprise you. Their sandwiches are loaded. And I'm not talking about their veggies - lettuce, tomato, sprouts, but their meat actually piles high. You WILL be full. 

--Grubbin: meat lovers dream 
--Juicin' : can't go wrong with a solid turkey, bacon, avo sammie. Paired with their jalapeno and grub sauce. Perfection. 
--Tastin' : round of applause for providing a veggie sandwich. I actually discovered just recently that veggie sandwiches are pretty damn good. The eggplant and avocade were the highlights of this sandwich. Sooooooo good! Non-guilty pleasure. 

If you really like wet sandwiches, they would be great for ya messy eaters! I usually like my sandwiches a little less crazy so I ask for less sauce, which is perfect for me! 

I have high hopes for this place and I only see it getting more popular. My only hope is that the quality and proportion of their ingredients won't dwindle when it gets its name out there.
author: Regina C.

description:
Solid sammies. Nothing to write home about, but definitely worth stopping by for a lunch time fix if you're in the area. 
The staff was friendly and accomodating.

Tip: Check-in on yellow for a free bag of chips!
author: Aleyna S.

description: This place is soooooo bomb!!! Relatively new, but it really exceeded my expectations of the perfect sandwich! Perfectly toasted Dutch crunch with soooo much meat and the perfect amount of toppings/condiments... drenched with their delicious grub sauce! Their sandwiches are perfect if you're hungry and you've had a long day of work/school or if you're just looking for something to share with your girlfriend/boyfriend/friend! $10 sandwich and comes with free chips! Atmosphere is very chill too if you wanna eat there! The workers are super nice and friendly too! Definitely have their customer service as well as culinary skills! Would highly recommend this sandwich shop, I think it's better than gene's, Ike's, and little luccas! My new go to spot!
author: Doug W.

description: I love this place! the only downfall is that they close early. I always get the Droolin'. If I can marry that sandwich, I would! big sandwich, I usually do two meals with it. sandwiches are toasted so it comes hot. Yummy!
author: Jules L.

description: Visiting from Reno for a soccer tournament and found this treasure between games. One of the best sandwiches I've ever had. Highly recommend it. Great service too.
author: John P.

description:
I came here with my cousin not too long ago and we were craving for some decent sandwiches. Decided to give grubbin' a shot after looking at the reviews. I ordered the grubbin' and he ordered juicin'. We both agreed that we like grubbin' more. It was sooooo goood! 

The tater tots with bacon, cheese and sour cream was meh..

Most definitely coming back for more sammies though!!
author: Tracy V.

description:
Sooo delicious!!!  We were incoherent from how hungry we were and found this place nearby on Yelp.  Even though it was noon on a weekend and there were a handful of people in the shop, we ordered and got our food pretty quickly which was great.

My partner and I shared the Droolin' and the Lickin'.  The Droolin' was MIND-BLOWINGly good!  The Lickin' was delicious also, especially as far as Corned Beef is concerned.  The Dutch Crunch bread though... omg in and of itself a reason to go to Grubbin'!!!

Also had a root beer float which was good but made with hard ice cream which isn't my fave.  All in all though, a spot I would definitely hit up regularly if I lived closeby.
author: Denise Z.

description: Yummy food and option, cool people working! It's a nice little spot on Taraval right near the train for your convenience. The menu names are fun and all well described. I've had a few things here including the tots and loved it!
author: Daniel S.

description:
This place is surprisingly nice for what looks like a makeshift kitchen. 

Wings and tater tots. Wow. I totally loved it and you can order the wings without sauce if you don't like buffalo flavoring. Plenty of dipping sauces too. 

Had a great lunch there after shopping across the street at Noriega Furniture (which is on Taraval).
author: Tracy Y.

description:
Today was my last day in Sunset before I move and I'm pleased to say my last lunch here was Grubbin. Their sandwiches are fresh, huge and the service is friendly. Its a small quaint place I recommend checking out. 

Ps- Try the Grubbin It. I thought it was going to be too salty given all that meat but it was delicious!
author: Lizz H.

description:
Gotta love a new and exciting new place in the neighborhood!

This place opened 2 months ago and they are doing great! I came here on a Sunday afternoon. The spot was pretty full and they are so popular that they ran out of some ingredients (dutch crunch bread and french bread) but the whole wheat bread I got was still good! 

I chose the "droolin'" sandwich, $8, which had some of the best pastrami I've had (made rare and chewy!), salami, veggies, and their house aioli sauce. It was a great sammy. Great big size, tasty, and oh that pastrami. It was a very refreshing sandwich. I love that the sandwiches come with free chips on the side. 

They have a nice selection of other sandwiches and also a make your own sandwich. All sandwiches are about $7-9. The quality is up to par! Their fries look really good too. I will have to come back to try them.

As a lot of new places are, the service was wonderful. The workers were very friendly and warm. You can really tell they want their new business to thrive. I appreciated their eagerness to display high customer service. 

Will come back for more sandwich goodness. Just beware that they run out of things fairly quickly so come early!
author: Junel S.

description: Me and my bestie were visiting a friend in the area and were hungry, after a quick visit on Yelp we decided to make the quick walk here. We both ordered the Sweet Mouth Waterin and an order of Cheesy Tots. Tots were okay, but the Sandwiches are delicious! They're big enough we could have gotten one and shared. Instead they were nice enough to wrap our leftovers. And those leftovers were delicious the next day, which in my experience is uncommon. When were in town, definitely hitting this spot up again.
author: Jaclyn M.

description:
My first time at Grubbin was a great experience, tried the Grubbin sandwich and was very impressed. I usually get my sandwiches at Gene's but after trying Grubbin,  consider me converted. Perfectly toasted, excellent portion size and well proportioned, which is what makes or breaks a sandwich. If you think sandwiches is all they do, think again! They have an assortment of side dishes and I can confidently vouch for their tator-tots and garlic fries.  Both were very crispy, very hot and very delicious. A one, two, three punch of starchy goodness. 

The staff were all really nice and they even walked the order out to my friend, which was a nice change from your typical, "yelling your order number from behind the counter" service . This was especially remarkable considering how busy they were. Our order was prepared quickly and with a smile.
author: Christopher T.

description:
Saw the place and came here around 3 right before the near by high school got out.

Empty. Workers greeted us with a smile.
3 of us together ordered the Grubbin, Fishin, and Grub fries.
Each sandwich is about $8-9 and the grub fries was $5 which is kinda pricey.
Friendly staff brought the food to our table.
I took a bite and had to take another one just to double check. 
I think I died .-.
Twassss soo good!
The price was justified.
We weren't able to finish and asked for a box to go then they offered to wrap it for us..  it was like a gift with the wrapping paper, tape, and an extra brown bag to carry it in. 

Definitely will come back and with more friends! :D
author: Mary-Angeline L.

description: This place is delicious! I'm picky on sandwiches, but this lived up to my expectations of Ike's, if not even better! Great customer service and worth the $8 or so. Quality sandwiches forsure!
author: Jessica U.

description: really yummy sandwiches! I usually get pastrami and they make it just right
author: Jessica W.

description: This place has really good sandwiches. They're known for their sandwiches having fish sticks and chicken tenders inside which are quite tasty especially with their special sauce. The only drawback to this place is that they are really slow at making sandwiches.  I feel like they need to be more efficient. I've eaten a lot of sandwich places and most of them are very quick such as Lou's Cafe and Submarine Center.   Other than that it's a good sandwich place.
author: Michael T.

description: I got the Grubbin sandwich and it was a very tastey sandwich. Service was awesome and i will be back to try another one. And they got tater tots!
author: Russell B.

description: Great sandwich joint and awesome staff! They stayed open late just to fill my oh so hungry belly!!!
author: James W.

description:
First time here on Sunday and I can already tell I'll be back.
 
They made a delicious sandwich. We made our own which was turkey on a dutch crunch with all of the fixins and their grub sauce. Which was BOMB. 

Inhaled it as soon as I got back to my car. 

We also ordered the grub fries which are garlic garlic garlic fries, I think I can still taste some garlic on my breath. Delicious.

I will say that it may be best to order and eat elsewhere since this place has limited seating and can get quite hot. They had a fan in the doorway.

But definitely worth checking out for a delicious sandwich.

Check in on yelp and get a free bag of chips!
author: Karma B.

description: Stopped in at Grubbin and got the Crunchin' on dutch crunch bread. The vegetables were fresh and the sauces were a perfect touch to the sandwich. One star shy of a perfect 5 because the tater totes were over cooked. Still a great spot for a tasty sandwich.
author: Iyohna P.

description: Fantastic sandwiches, great staff. These are special sandwiches unlike anywhere else. Plus good selection of drinks. And decent prices!
author: Carolyn S.

description: Good service! Friendly workers! The food was good, nothing too exciting from this sandwich shop. The cheesy tater tots with sour cream and bacon were good! Went on a humid day, they only had fans. The place was near a high school, so you'll see students by around 3:00pm. Parking on the streets.
author: Ariane P.

description: I used to come here pretty often during lunch while I'm at school, but I chose to stop going after they served my raw chicken tenders on several occasions. They're just trying to get the food out the door, they don't really care about the quality that much. Very inconsistent experiences.
author: Justin D.

description:
So delicious! We ate here one week ago and I'm still thinking about the sandwiches from this place. I like it way more than Ikes and Submarine Center. It's different from Little Lucca's because both places have their own distinct signature sauces. 

We had the Grubbin and the Droolin (which I added some peppers). The Droolin was spicy but not so much that it overwhelmed the other flavors. The sandwich was rather big (so the price of $9 ain't too high) and I only ate 3/4 of it. I finished the rest of the sandwich later that night and it was still so good. 

Highlights of the sandwiches: 
1. Signature sauces (the different types of aioli and grubbin sauce)
2. Moist and tender pastrami 
3. Dutch Crunch bread
4. The perfect amount of meat to veggies to sauce ratio in my sandwich

I'm definitely coming back.
author: Kar Y.

description:
Although I left a little disappointed (I asked for a sandwich to go with everything and pepproncinis, but only realized they forgot the pepperoncini's when I arrived home), I was still very satisfied with my sandwich. I ordered a Mouth Watherin' on dutch crunch and it was really tasty. The chicken tenders weren't dry and still maintained a nice breaded texture despite being sauced up in the middle of a sandwich. The veggies tasted fresh and the grubbin' sauce added some nice creamy garlic flavor to the mix. The only critique I had was that it was a little heavy and one note in flavor, but had they added my pepperoncinis I think that would've solved the issue.

I also ordered some Tots which came out great. I asked for a small order, but when I got home and opened the container, it was enough to feed 2 peeps. Also, even being transported to go (which took only a few minutes to my place) they held up really well and were still quite crispy and weren't as greasy as tots you'll find from other restaurants. The cheesy version will be on my list for my next visit.

It was also pretty cool, that I got a canned soda for free with my sandwich purchase!

I'm definitely looking forward to trying again. Hopefully next time, they remember my pepperoncinis!
author: Jeffrey J.

description:
I finally decided to try this place this morning after getting coffee at Trolley Cafe. It's a nice little spot with some seating and a wall mounted tv, pretty straight forward. 

I ordered the 'Juicin' sandwich which was turkey, avocado, sprouts, etc on sourdough. I was skeptical about trying this place before because I felt the price was a little high for a sandwich (about $9), but I have to say it was well worth every dollar, and the sandwich was so big I could only eat half and saved the rest for later haha.
