An even amount of everything in it and the bread toasted just right. 

With that type of first experience, and a polite and friendly staff, I will most definitely be back!
author: Nate C.

description: My new favorite place for sandwiches! My husband had the grubbin' and I had the juicin' on Dutch crunch. The sandwiches are a good generous size and the sauce they use is pretty tasty. The tater tots with bacon and cheese was delicious! The staff is very friendly. Definitely going back!
author: GINGER Y.

description: A nice touch to the neighborhood! Sandwiches are on point! They have a nice selection of sandwiches as well. I'm writing this review as I am eating my grubbin' sandwich ;) prices are reasonable. Quality is great. But small selection of chips which is fine since they're pretty new. Convenient!
author: Richie K.

description: On the line for this one. Sandwich was pretty good. Bread was good quality although the same you get at sandwich places everywhere--they clearly aren't making it themselves or anything. Ingredients were fresh, flavor varieties were clever. Sides were solid. Unfortunately of the four people there, only one of them actually made sandwiches, while the others sat around and talked, which made for really slow service. Getting their service issues together would quickly up my review so I'll try again and see if it was an off day.
author: Daniel E.

description:
Pretty darn good!  I'm definitely coming back here. 

I went by there tonight, and while they are still putting on the final touches for the lighting and dining area, I was able to order up one of their "juicin' sandwiches. Translation: juicin = turkey, avocado, bacon & fresh onions with their pesto aioli on a roll of your choice.   Given my previous experiences with rather mediocre sandwich places on this side of town, my expectations were somewhat low going in..  But the sandwich here was clearly several levels above any typical chain sandwich shop, and better than any usual mom & pop type of place.

Fresh ingredients. No skimping on the meat, shredded lettuce, Toasted Dutch crunch bread, and a complimentary soft drink or free bottled water too. $8.60 out the door for a 9" long big TASTY sandwich. 

Friendly service too!

Yep.. I'll be back for the tater tots next time!!
author: Harry W.

description: Came here for a pre-hike meal and I ordered a Spicy Mouth Waterin on wheat. It was delicious because the spicy aioli went really well with the chicken tenders. I would definitely come back
author: Wilfred S.

description:
A great option for lunch in parkside. Sandwiches are $7-9, which is the norm for specialty sandos these days. Regular fries $3, and very tasty! 

I had the grubbin' on Dutch with a small fries. The bread, which can make or break a good sandwich, was perfect. And, everything was in good proportion. I read another review claiming a shortage of meat, and while it's not piled high, you won't be left hungry. The fries are standard shoe strings crispy and salty. Perfect for my taste.  

In the end I was very satisfied, and will be back to try out the other options.
author: Seth D.

description:
I wanted to go a few times before writing a review just in case the first couple experiences were a fluke. No fluke here. It's consistently awesome. I have tried all the sandwiches accept the eggplant. Where to start. 

Turkey ham bacon avacado sprouts etc etc. the things you expect in a sandwich. Wait... they have corn beef too.  In a   Dutch crunch sourdough or  whole wheat roll. This is important but anyone who knows of Ike's or little Lucas knows the sauce can make or break the sandwich. Grubbin sauce?! Good name. Its garlicky. Risky. Too garlicky and some won't like it. Not garlicky enough and people won't notice it's in the sandwich. The sauce you can tell has gone through some great taste tests because its perfect. Not too garlicky. Just the right amount. 

The service is great and during their grand opening special a free soda. Ok so do we get our Money's worth. Lets just say I went a couple days ago. Someone came in and ordered a sandwich to go, the sandwich was dropped into the bag by the customer. Sandwich all wrapped up of course went through the bag. Maybe the only thing I could suggest to improve the grubbin experience is thicker to go bags. Haha. Definitely a must try place.
author: eric t.

description:
Delicious sandwiches! I like the Sweet Mouth Waterin'.. its the prefect blend of taste and the chicken tender is delicious. We've also had the Crunchin' (veggie lovers) and it was also great. About $10 bucks a sandwich but definitely worth the price and size. I usually split one with my friend.

I'm a regular now! =)
author: Dee L.

description: Delicious sandwiches. The service was about average speed, but the taste was awesome. I had the Kickin'.  If you like spicey, give it a shot.
author: Patrick W.

description: This place predates Lou's cafe one block down and it has a great selection of sandwiches with equally awesome names. If you can't decide, get the namesake grubbin' sandwich and you won't be disappointed. Plus it's not overly expensive like certain sandwich shops are getting so it's good for your wallet and belly!
author: Wilson T.

description: Just moved to SF and it's definitely my favorite sandwich spot in the city. The Spicy Mouthwaterin js bomb.com!
author: David D.

description:
These are high quality sandwiches! You will not be disappointed. They do it up right. The Dutch crunch bread is an added bonus. Also a bonus: super friendly staff.

The place isn't large so seating might be tight. Don't let that stop you. Go to the park next door and have a picnic!
author: Dusty F.

description: Open for 2 years man, wish I knew earlier. One word to some up this place "Grubbin". Name suits the place well. Check it out!
author: G T.

description: I absolutely LOVE grubbin ! I found this place through yelp and gave it a try with my boyfriend about an year ago when they just started and been going ever since. It's a shame I'm only now putting up a review on this place. I've tried their sweet mouth waterin', spicy mouth waterin', juicin', and this other one with pineapples in it and they are all amazing ! although i have to say juicin' is my favorite. people say Ike's is the best sandwich in town, but i say Grubbin is !! There's been a couple times when the wait was long, but i always got a super fresh sandwich to make up for it. If you have a issue with waiting, you can call them ahead to place an order. if you're reading this yelpers, go get a sandwich here ! (:
author: Hae Rim H.

description: Finally tried (well the Mister did) after my coworker had told me about this place for a while. This sammie place is run by a cute little Chinese family. He ordered the Juicin and it was delish. The ingredients were fresh and the Mister is picky. I can't believe we didn't try this place sooner!
author: C. T.

description: Soooooooo slow!!! If you have nothing better to do than wait for a sandwich come here!!
author: Jason W.

description: Just ate the Spicy Mouth Waterin' and it was delicious. Everything about the sandwich I enjoyed. If you are looking for a Buffalo Chicken Sandwich, it's not, but it's just as good. It's a great little spot in the Sunset. The service was fast and friendly, the prices are cheap, and the sandwiches are awesome. It's definitely comparable to Ike's but with way better prices and not a fraction of the wait. If you want a quick bite in the Sunset, check this place out, it's great.
author: Sean D.

description: So happy this little shop opened up in my neighborhood! One sandwich feeds me for lunch and dinner. I crave this sandwich when I am out of town.
author: Christina K.

description: Got the chicken sandwich with honey mustard (forgot the name)and it was delicious. Asked for it on sourdough and it was hot when served. Very quick and friendly service. Generous sandwich size too. Overall great place for a quick lunch.
author: Adam H.

description:
Nom! I'm so happy there's a delicious sandwich place in the area now. The sandwiches here are humongous and addictive! The sauces they put in each sandwich just put the sandwiches over the top. I let 4 different people have bites on my very first Grubbin' sandwich, and now they're all in love with it too. 

I also like how each sandwiches have so many things in it. It's hard to decide what to get but in the end, anything on the menu is good. I have tried 4 different ones here so far and they're all unique and fulfilling. I personally  like the Grubbin' a lot though, and I usually don't even like sprouts (but I'll eat it in this sandwich)! 

Staffs are friendly! Parking is pretty easy around the neighborhood.
author: Mandy C.

description:
Came in here with my 2 children (3.5 yrs & 11 months old) after running a couple of errands as a "treat" for my eldest.  The woman at the counter was extremely friendly and accommodating.  I got myself the Sweet Mouth Waterin' and a generic ham & cheese for my daughter.  Mine was excellent and my daughter at an entire half of her sandwich!  I wanted something that I could give the baby too - a few slices of deli meat and some avocado.  So the woman just charged me a couple "extras" on my sandwich and gave me what I needed for the babe!  Any place that's willing to work with me to help out the kids and not nickel & dime me is worth 5 stars in my book.

And I know it's worth 5 stars in my daughter's book too because she was offered a lollipop before we left (after asking my permission, of course).  I'll definitely go back if I'm in the neighborhood again!
author: Michele S.

description: Very disappointing sandwich. Quality of meat was horrible. Looked and tasted like packages Oscar Meyer turkey. Hardly any veggies too. The only good part was the Dutch crunch bread. Hate giving negative reviews, but I would not go back.
author: Sasha S.

description: This place has super yummy sandwiches! Many different types of good breads & spreads to choose from and the staff is friendly and efficient. I will absolutely be back and would recommend to friends.
author: Karen M.

description:
I have been here twice now as I just moved to the area and wanted to see what was in my neighborhood. 
Looked this place up and gave it a try. 

Very friendly staff, reasonably priced sandwiches, and great selection. Tried the "grubbin" sandwich first which was delicious, got the "kickin" sandwich second which was even better!  Very toasty bread, has the perfect crunch. The sandwiches have just the right mix of flavors, no ingredients over power each other. The sauce is juicy and so good I had to lick it off the paper. 

Also tried the cheesy tots the first time I went which were a little pricey, but out of this world. Nice crispy, golden tots with melted cheese, bacon, and sour cream. I shared them and was only able to eat half of my sandwich I was so full, but the second half was very good left over. 


I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a good hot sandwich. I'll definitely be back to try the rest of the sandwiches.
author: Cole H.

description:
so delicious!!

it was my first time trying this place yesterday. I'm such a sandwich snob too, but it definitely exceeded my expectations! I had the "droolin" on wheat (no cheese). The wheat bread was surprisingly delightful. I normally would choose Dutch crunch (who wouldn't?!), but they were sold out of every other bread--again, another reflection of sandwich success. Anyways, back to the wheat--it was mildly sweet and flavorful. Not too much bread either (you know, when it overpowers the rest of the ingredients). The sauce was key! Typically, my favorite pastrami sandwich is from Subcenter--but the one downside is that, that sandwich is too "drippy" and messy. But this one isn't, it's a very "neat" sandwich, if that makes sense. Very filling as well, I was able to save the other half for a late night snack. 

Oh, and I had some tater tots too--such a great idea! Reminds me of my middle school days. 

Can't wait to try the other sandwiches. Plus, it's a bonus that it's open on Sundays!
author: Julie N.

description:
I'm a sandwich addict, and would have to say that this one of my go to spot for a mouth watering sammie fix! 

They have list of specialty sandwiches, with wide variety combos. I usually do a customized order, depending on what I'm craving for that day. Their "grub sauce' is delicious! Oh, and they also have a bunch of sides such as, tatter tots, fries, wings etc... 

Sandwiches under $10

Fast and friendly service

Not skimp on meat :)
author: Lils C.

description: So delicious!! The dutch crunch bread is the best-- soft with crunch on top and so fresh. The roast beef is fantastic too!
author: Alisha O.

description: I had the Crunchin' which is the cucumber vegetarian sandwich. The sandwich was great, especially the bread (I got Dutch crunch) and the magic sauce (aioli I believe). Quick build time, nice quiet location (we went in the middle of the afternoon, can't speak for lunch hours). Will definitely go back here, the best sandwiches I've had in the Sunset, hands down.
author: jon o.

description: Went here for a late lunch around 2:00pm and the place was empty, so no wait which was great.  Ordered the Kickin' with everything on it.  This is roast beef with wasabi aioli.  It's a solid sandwich, but nothing special.  I expected more for a $9 sandwich.  Since I was the only customer, my order was done quickly.  Overall, love the name, decent food, but not good enough to bring me back.
author: Kevin Y.

description: So I am going to hope that I came on an off day...they were out of bread by 1:45, only had enough left for two sandwiches and I needed three. Decided to go for it anyways and just share. 25 minutes later I am still standing here with no food. Slowest sandwich shop I've ever been to. There are 4 people working here, no other customers after me since no bread, and yet they can't seem to make two turkey sandwiches in less than a half hour. I'm sorry, but that's just not ok. Hope the food is at least decent...will change my review if the sandwiches are stellar, but either way am not likely to return.
author: Melissa F.

description:
I came to Grubbin' with a friend last night, and the service was excellent. We entered the Sandwich Shop only 10 minutes before closing, and were greeted by the nicest guy who gave clear suggestions and options for first timers. My friend got a Sandwich (which was very tasty) and we both got garlic fries (even tastier). 

Customer Service: 5/5
Food: 4.5/5
Overall Experience: 5/5

I will definitely go back.
author: Daniel H.

description: Awesome sandwich place in the Sunset. I always get the Droolin...good amount of meat...the soft roll is perfectly toasted to my liking. A good sandwich must consist of good bread.
author: Phi N.

description: First time here, small cozy place to grab a sandwich and go. Staff is friendly and nice. Nice and clean environment. Wait time if you are with a group of people will be about 20 minutes if you aren't eating there. Sandwich is better than Mr. Pickles and less expensive as well.
author: Camille W.

description:
Great sandwich spot in the Sunset...fresh fast and inexpensive.
Not sure why dude complained about A/C...this is the city!
author: Craig G.

description: Grubbin is a cute sammie spot in my hood. Love the fact they have cute names for their sandwiches with a variety of toppings (peppercionis, jalapenos, etc no extra charge woot!) They carry my ultimate fave of bread - dutch crunch - AND they toast your sandwich!!  They have 3 tables inside with some additional stool window seating too. We usually can always grab a seat and watch the game or whatever they have on while we grubbin! Only downside is sometimes the sandwiches do take awhile but last time they gave us a heads up on the wait when we ordered so that was much appreciated. Maybe one day they will do a sandwich punch card you know, like the kind where you buy 10 get one free. Hehe...thats obvs for my selfish reasons only since we go so much!
author: Julie F.

description:
I am so in love with the Juicin' sandwich here. And I don't even like turkey sandwiches!! It's nice to finally have a bomb ass sandwich place by my house. I've tried a few things from here:

Juicin' - turkey, bacon, avocado. OMG the best turkey sandwich I have ever had. Normally I hate getting turkey sandwiches cause they're just so..basic..like ham and you could make it yourself. But this place is the ONLY place I would ever pay for a turkey sandwich. Insanely delicious, super flavorful. I can't even describe. Perfect sandwich. 

Droolin - pastrami and salami. I was excited about this one but it's not as good as it sounds. Somehow there's just a weird flavor and it doesn't work well. (Other places do the same but it works) wouldn't get this sandwich again. 

Cheesy tater tots - with ranch and bacon. Pretty good but it can be a little salty when you get the bacon. 

Garlic fries - pretty expensive for very little. Just the basic garlic fries... I wouldn't recommend it cause it doesn't come with much. 

Overall, just get the Juicin on Dutch crunch and you won't regret it. As much as I love this place.. I hope it doesn't get TOO popular cause I don't want to have to wait in line....
author: Grace S.

description: Delicious! If you're craving a fatty sandwich I would highly recommend stopping by. One of my fave sandwich joints is Ike's and this is on par. Husband and I tried the Grubbin' It and Spicy Mouth Waterin' both on dutch crunch bread. The chicken tenders in the Spicy Mouth Waterin' sammie are nicely fried and the sauce is not really spicy. Make sure to take advantage of the Yelp check in for a free bag of chips. There is also inside seating and they have TVs usually playing sports. Parking is not terrible, given its Outer Sunset - but the L can dump you off nearby if need be. Enjoy!
author: Lisa H.

description:
Came here recently and tried a sandwich. I enjoyed it and thought it was delicious. The sandwich reminded me of other sandwich places I like in the city such as Roxie's. 

  Price is okay, thought sandwiches would've been around $7-8 for a sandwich, but it came out to $9 something because you get a "free" soda or chips with it for their promotion grand opening. I rather pay $7-8 and not take the soda or chips. Yelp has this place at $, true if you order a sandwich alone, but anything on top of a sandwich more is $$.

  I read reviews of previous yelpers saying the staff is friendly, but when I went in one day, only the cashier was friendly out of the 3-4 people there. And my definition of friendly is either a simple smile or greeting. No one else smiled and seemed like they were happy to be there except for the cashier.

  But, regardless of the negative, I am a fan and of this joint and will most likely come back.
author: Pudgy G.

description: Lovely little sandwich place with a limited but well-thought-out menu. I stopped by for a lunchtime sandwich and ordered the crunch, one of two veggie sandwiches. The sandwich itself was brilliant - absolutely delicious - but I did have to wait almost thirty minutes for it. A very, very long time for a sandwich, especially because there was no line when I ordered and it wasn't exactly packed in the restaurant. It was worth it, but I don't know that I will be able to come back on lunch break again if it takes that long. Pity because damn, that sandwich was good.
author: Kate M.

description: Ummmm holy sh** this place is dank! Don't even think twice about it. I wish they were down in LA!
author: Dan R.

description: Found this Gem on yelp while doing a family hike at lands end trail to get some lunch all i can say is omg bomb.com sandwiches were so good all my family enjoyed all our sandwiches definitely coming back again soon yummy.
author: Omar Q.

description: My friend picked up a sammy for me and it was good. It's pretty big for the price and I love the garlic fries. They are skinny, crispy, and just the right amount of garlic.
author: Karen H.

description: Ever since grubbin opened I have not sought out any other sandwich. I came in here, not much of a sandwich person. I am always eating the same roast beef sandwich wherever I go but I dared take a chance on one of their signature sandwiches called "Grubbin' it" ugh.... Best decision ever. The meats are perfection and the sauce is amazing. You're going to get a juicy flavorful sandwich to make you realize how seriously good sandwiches are SUPPOSED to me. The sandwich is big! I ate that bad boy as two meals! If you're a g you can eat the whole thing but you might knock out! They also have many sides to order but I stuck with classy chips that came free from checking in on yelp (free is awesome). I recommend this shop to all my friends. If you're unsure of some of the sauces ask for a sample, they're all delicious and they will gladly let you try one so you're sure you want it on your food!
author: Paula P.

description: Been here a few times now, this place is awesome. Great quality sandwiches at a very, very affordable price. Every time I come in here I always try something new and it never disappoints. The people who work there are very friendly too. If you're in the area and want a quick bite to eat or are craving a nice, yummy sandwich I highly recommend this place. One of the hidden gems on Taraval and in the Sunset district.
author: Henry Y.

description: My partner and I were in the Sunset and wanted something close to Crafttea and found this place with awesome reviews on yelp so we had to check it out.  He ended up getting the Juicin and I got the Fishin.  The sandwich itself was pretty good, the fish comes out as a patty and is crispy and hot.  My counterpart also said the juicin was good (although it's hard to mess up a turkey sandwich)  The prices are a little bit up there around $8-9 a sandwich, but they're pretty big and definitely able to save the other half for another time.  Will be back to try out more!
author: Roger W.

description: The sandwiches here are to die for. They are the best sandwiches ever, and I have had many. I am also a really picky eater, so when I say its good you better believe it. The tastin sandwich is my favorite, and their garlic fries rule too. This is one of those places that I would drive hours for, but luckily it's an 8 minute drive from my house.
author: Emily G.

description: I'm not a huge sandwich person, but I am when I come here! I love the sandwiches here. My favorite is the Grubbin It on a dutch crunch roll. Also, they turned me into a lover of sprouts on my sandwich.
author: Tiffany G.

description: Yummy yummy sandwiches. Toasty bread. Garlic fries were awesome. Bread was nice and toasty!
author: Rebecca H.

description: I consider myself a sandwich snob. This place is awesome. The ingredients are all fresh and the toasted bread is so good. The grubbin sauce adds a perfect flavor to the sandwich.
author: Darius A.

description: Bomb sandos! Before i went here for the first time someone said that Grubbin was an Ikes rip off. Well since i love Ikes i was only encouraged to give Grubbin a try and I'm glad i did! And while there may be some similarities with Ikes  (bread selection, different sauces, creative combinations, etc.) what i loved that was different was the ease of selection (refined menu vs the 100 different sandwiches at Ikes) and very little wait time. I've tried three or four different sandwiches now, all were delicious but my current favorite is the ham and pineapple! Menu prices are reasonable for the city and the sandwiches are a decent size, sometimes making for two meals depending on my appetite. The restaurant interior is plain with a few tables,  prob better for take out. Recommended for any food/sandwich enthusiasts!
author: Dylan B.

description: Amazing little hole in the wall that produces incredibly fresh, delicious sandwiches. We ordered the Juicin' sandwich with tater tots and will be going back for more.
author: Pablo G.

description: Got the Kickin' with everything and a small tots.  The tots were nice and crispy, the Kickin on dutch crunch was delicious.
author: T. E.

description: Glad I found this sandwich shop!!  I've been here about 10 times now and each time has been great.  Get the sando on a Dutch crunch roll.  You won't be disappointed with any selection.
author: Joe D.

description: This place is probably one of the best sandwich shops in the Sunset. I've become somewhat of a regular and love, love, love the Fishin'. Is fried fish, veggies and their signature grubbin sauce and its delectable! Until I get food poisoned (for some reason its fish that tends to do that to people) I'll keep coming!
author: Tiarra E.

description:
THIS PLACE IS AWESOME!!! I ordered the Savorin' ($8+tax=$8.80), and it was sooo delicious. I was very pleasantly surprised.  
Don't let the pictures fool you--this sandwich is anything but ordinary! However, the sandwiches aren't too big...I'm not exactly sure how long they are, but I would guess maybe a bit longer than 6 inches. Doesn't really matter to me though. The sandwich packs a punch! I checked in so I also got a free small bag of chips which was nice. 

The workers are nice. When I went at about 2:50pm on Wednesday, there was no line. My sandwich was nice and warm and ready to be picked up about 5 minutes later. 

Compared to Little Lucca in SSF and Ikes in the Mission district of SF, I would say this sandwich is almost as good--which is really really good. 

I will definitely be returning to Grubbin' to try their other sandwiches.
author: K T.

description: Get the sweet mouthwatering chicken sandwich on dutchcrunch wit everythang on it. Shits fuckin delicious!
author: Kevin C.

description: Bf went to go pick up some sandwiches. I tried the droolin on Dutch crunch which was good but had too much mayo for my taste. I took a bite from my Bfs spicy mouth waterin sandwich and it tasted better than I thought it would. I expected them to use dry, ballpark food stand tasting chicken tenders but the chicken was super crispy and juicy! It kinda reminded me of a spicy McChicken but on Dutch crunch bread. We also got some cheesy tots which are your standard tator tots with cheese, sour cream, and bacon bits. Overall good sandwich shop in the neighbor but not something I would find myself craving for.
author: Michelle H.

description: Mmmmmm sandwich was delicious. Droolin' is what I ordered for 8$-9$ or something. Very tasteful and a kick behind it. Used Dutch bread as this sandwich is served hot. Beautiful customer service and a wonderful experience. Will return if I am in the area.
author: Lee J.

description: The Dutch Crunch was delightful. It absolutely made my day. Mmmm... This place is a must destination.
author: Bonnie L.

description: Great sandwiches, helpful and friendly staff. Haven't gone wrong yet.  They were very, very, slow to begin with, but the speed has picked up.  Come here with an appetite, or have lunch for two days.
author: Jonathan W.

description: Tasty! Great little neighborhood spot with creative sandwiches and a very friendly staff.
author: Candid K.

description: Can be a little slow when busy but they're sandos are excellent.  Best Dutch Crunch bread I've had.
author: Erik L.

description:
first time trying the dutch style bread.

LUVED IT!!!
author: C C.

description: Don't Get Run over by the MUNI when crossing the street! joke a side this place is a must try very quaint place with a pop of flavor . I enjoyed the sprouts in my Grubbin it sandwitch along with there saws the flavors all blended very well together if your in the area and your hungry give them a try.
author: Elizabeth B.

description: So glad that we have a new sandwich shop I'm the neighborhood. Great food, large portions, great price! It's clean and they are helpful and friendly. We need to support this new business and make sure that their business thrives!
author: Kimberly R.

description: I'm so glad I live across the street. The sandwiches are great (so far I've tried the Juicin', the Spicy Mouth Waterin', and the Crunchin'), and the staff are always SUPER friendly. A sandwich here is usually $7-$9, but they're pretty large and SO GOOD. You also get to choose your bread (I always get Dutch crunch) and you have the option to customize sandwiches too.
author: Lauren F.

description: This place is highly rated for a reason! The sandwiches are spectacular! I loved the Juicin', it really hit the spot and then some! I came in expecting a typical deli sandwich, and I got a hot, melty, delicious, HUGE sandwich fit for a king. As a couple, we each got a sandwich and split an order of Garlic Fries (also very tasty), and neither of us could touch the second half of our sandwiches, we were so full. They wrapped it up for us, and it even tasted good as leftovers. My boyfriend is a vegetarian, and we were also delightfully surprised that there were a couple vegetarian signature sandwiches, as well as the option to create your own. Either way, 10/10 will chow down again.
author: Brittany S.

description: The sandwiches looked so delicious in the pictures, but the Grub Sauce leaves an odd, relish-y taste that I wasn't feeling. I got the Juicin' with turkey, avocado and cheese on a French roll. The roll was delicious. I'd get the same sandwich but without their specialty sauce.
author: Sam D.

description: This place is worth stopping by for. The outside looks pretty chic, inside has a tv to watch entertainment. Their sandwiches are really good and pretty big. I ordered it with another friend + garlic fries, great combo. I got the Kickin' sandwich which had some wasabi and if you cant hand wasabi, most def should not get this sandwich. But for me, since i like it, the sandwich was really good but the wasabi did overwhelm the meat/cheese/lettuce/tomato a bit in the middle. Overall, great experience here.
author: Jamie U.

description: Jus discovered this place about a month ago and this place rocks, simple but amazing.
author: Johnny B.

description: I always come here for the chicken tenders and fries :3 they're very good, and not too salty nor bland and they come out at a pretty decent pace too~ Maybe i'll come here to try the sandwiches some other time since they're what the place is mainly known for!
author: Tina W.

description:
a solid 4 stars.

good sandwich, solid sandwich, but nothing to rave about. I would prefer this over gene's...and I don't see how they would compare to ike's...

their aioli and grub sauce could use a little extra pop, but not complaining! 

we tried the juicin' and droolin', I liked the sprouts in the juicin'! tasted healthy. haha

garlic fries were garlicky and good too. we'll be back!
author: Christine M.

description: So went by here yesterday to try this place out. Had a "Drooln'" sandwich...pastrami/salami/pepper jack cheese/spicy aioli/grub sauce/dutch crunch bread/$8/chips..This was quite the big surprise....this place is AWESOME !....you'd better check this sandwich shop out NOW! i will be going here often for myself and family...the food is great...don't know whats in the grub sauce....but its fantastic ! go there now....nice to see something different in the hood for a change...
author: David R.

description: This is a great sandwich. Better than Little Lucca in SSF. The sauce has great flavor and it is not runny like other places. Meat and bread are superb.
author: Frank L.

description: Good eats. Glad I found this place. The smothered tots and the lickin' are where it's at.
author: Dave N.

description: The best sandwiches i have ever had in Bay Area  i tried droolin sandwiches that was great .
author: Shadi Z.

description: 5 stars. Super nice to me and the sandwiches rival Ike's! Recommend the sweet chicken one. Happy to have in my neighborhood!
author: Domenique B.

description: Delicious buffalo wings and sandwiches. The dutch bread is really good too! Very reasonably priced!
author: Athena K.

description: Stopped by here for the first time today and got the "Juicin'" sandwich I think it was called. It was very good and the people working there seemed nice. The sandwich tasted very fresh and was pretty frickin big. They have good Dutch crunch bread, which is key for me.  Plus, their sandwiches come with a soda of your choice, which is some nice added value. I will be back for sure.
author: Brett P.

description: I wanted to try and sub place within walking distance and noticed this place. I went in for the first time today and tried the Droolin'. It was delicious. Plenty of meat, the veggies were good and I liked the sauces. There was only one person in front of me, and it seemed like it took a while to make it, but it was worth it. I'll definitely be back to try more of the menu.
author: Matt H.

description: Great Sandwhich spot for the sunset/parkside area. The sandwich was awesome, i had the Drooli and the buffalo wings were crackin.
author: Ray G.

description: Very solid dutch-crunch based sammie. Proper ratio of fillings, and seasoned correctly. The best meat between bread west of 19th avenue? Perhaps.
author: Anthony R.

description: Quickly becoming one of my favorite sandwich spots, the Grub sauce is truly to die for. Service is always fast and friendly, and I have yet to be disappointed. A place to come back to over and over again, I would highly recommend to anyone. :)
author: Anna G.

description: This place was just okay, we tried it because we live in the sunset so it was convenient.  I had the Juicin' on Dutch Crunch, it was nothing special. My boyfriend and I try A LOT of sandwich spots along the bay area and I wouldn't come back here. The turkey seems very processed, like a safeway package and the dutch crunch was very bland. Not a bad sandwich, but Little Luccas is way better for the same price and double the size.
author: Jackie S.

description:
The food itself was amazing, ordered a build-your-own sandwich and it, along with with fries, was great. 
The cashier was friendly too, really nice and offered to wrap the remaining half of my sandwich (they're HUGE).
My concern is with the girl behind the counter making sandwiches. I overheard her coworkers asking her repeatedly to go wash her hands and her response was, "No, I'm wearing gloves!"
Kept eavesdropping and learned that she had cut her hand and it was bleeding. Ew? Seriously girl, go wash your hands. She refused for a good 5 minutes, then her coworkers told her to get a bandaid on. Again, "I'm wearing gloves! It's ok!" Let me add that this girl was making MY sandwich. 
I finally get my sandwich and made sure it was blood free but wasn't really hungry after hearing all that. If you work in food service, it really concerns me that you have to be forced to wash your hands and prefer having a bloody glove than wearing a bandaid:(
I'd come back, but now I know who shouldn't make my sandwich.
author: Adriana L.

description: This place is good every time. I've only ever gotten taken out from here and all the sandwiches have been good. The only reason I'm giving 4 stars instead of 5 is one time I got the mouth watering and it didn't have any tomatoes in it and the staff didn't let me know. Otherwise awesome, and our go to sandwich place.
author: Ella M.

description: Best sandwich I've had in a long time! Staff is okay but I'm not paying for customer service.. Our food came out quick and hot and so good.. Place is very tiny inside, not to busy but we went on a Monday at noon...We were 2 adults with a baby and jogging stroller and fit in just fine but I wouldn't recommend that when this place is super busy.. I will be back
author: Crystal V.

description: Had the juicin' sandwich, pretty good. The bread was toasted perfectly, a good bite of meat and yummy veggies. Id go back
author: Tiffany F.

description: On our way to the airport- they got us in and out in 30 minutes fully satisfied! Had the Dutch crunch bread for the first time in my life and it was amazing!! Meats were lean and tasty. Sandwich combinations were spot on flavorful. My kids had the chicken nuggets which were homemade lean chicken breast. Prices were fine for quality. They lost one star for the bathroom! HC accessible, but stacked with boxes and supplies. I don't know about you, but I don't want to find out my napkins and condiments were stored in the bathroom.  Also blocked the handicap accessibility. Shame!
author: John B.

description: I'm vegeterian and love the eggplant sandwich. The staff is great and the grubbin sauce is to die for. This is a great hidden gem for sandwiches in the city if you are trying to escape long lines at other sandwich spots that shall be unnamed. It's always a treat. When I was working in the city I'd eat here 4 to 5 times a week. Now make the trek just because I love the sandwiches.
author: Marc T.

description: This place is a little hole in the wall but nonetheless amazing! There are 3 young fellas that run the place (I believe). They are super sweet and patient with you. I tried the spicy chicken on a dutch roll and it was AMAZEBALLS! I think my deli experience has forever been ruined because no sandwich will ever taste that good. I will DEF be stopping by anytime I am in the area
author: Jennifer F.

description: HANDS DOWN best american sandwich I've ever had. Deserves all the stars in the world. Sandwich might be pricy, but It's like HUGE. Save it for 2 meals.
author: Ken T.

description: I ordered my Droolin sandwich and it was massive.  It was later that evening so they ran out of whole grain roll, but I will be back to give it a second       I couldn't finish the second half.  Paid just $9 + tax + Free complimentary soda.  The place is small but is the right size type of shop and prime location.  Lincoln High School Student with ID can also get a discount rate.
author: S F.

description: Lou's down the block was closed on Sunday so ended up ordering sandwiches from Grubbin.  We followed the great reviews on Yelp and decided to try them.  Glad we did.  The Crispy Fried Chicken sandwich was delicious.  We also ordered another sandwich which was just as good.  Even got a free chip with the Yelp sign in.  Both sandwiches were on Dutch Crunch.  Even went back a second time to Grubbin and it did not disappoint.  Can't wait to try other sandwiches.
author: Em D.

description: Absolutely amazing for those sandwich lovers!!! Stopped by on the way to San Fran on a wim and definitely worth the stop... Amazing!!! Tried the grubbin' an juicin'
author: Jeremy C.

description: Excellent sandwich!  Very nice people too. Spicy tatter tots - yum!  Highly recommend this place for a sandwich
author: Jean G.

description: This place has great food. The sandwiches are awesome!!  The sauces are incredible! And the portions are big. The neighborhood really needed a place like this! Every sandwich is packed with flavor!! Yum! I also got a sandwich to go once, and I was so busy completely forgot about it!! I had it later that night and it was just as good later as it is when it's fresh!! My new favorite spot!!!
author: Serena T.

description: Called in 4 sandwiches n didn't have to wait. Got in n out in less than 2 minutes. Also checkedin on yelp n got a free bag of chips. Sandwiches were also. I got the grubbin n it was awesome
author: Way G.

description: I had the Juicin, it was delicious. Perfectly prepared. I'd come again and again if I didn't live in Florida.
author: Toni F.

description: Located on Taravel, this is a pretty good sandwich shop.  They have a nice assortment of choices and very cool sandwiches.  They have a student special which isn't bad for $5.  The sandwiches are all served hot and the portions are pretty big.  You definitely get value.  You also can check in for chips!
author: Brian C.

description:
My boyfriend and I went here early today and man that was an amazing sandwhich w/ fresh bread and great grub sauce! 

I created my own and everything was great! My boyfriend got the "Juicin" and he loved it! 

Very clean also! Def 5 stars!
author: Tamera G.

description:
maaaaan.

*groans in satisfaction* 

this place is just sublime for those people who want just a simply great sandwich. their prices aren't bad at all, their food proportions are amazing and whats more, they CARE about your experience there! The whole time I was at the place,a guy asked everyone how their food was, and was sincere,  that is great restraunteering if you ask me.

I got the mouth waterin', and it was everything it said it would be. Juicy and crispy chicken tenders enveloped in some grubbin' sauce and jalepenos and, and, just perfection. 

definitely gonna be a regular here.
author: Juan Carlos S.

description: this place makes amazing sandwiches!! judging by the appearance, this place is pretty new; let's give them some business sunset!!!
author: John H.

description: Grubbin sauce makes their sandwiches craveworthy. It's garlicky goodness that combines well with avocado and veggies on the "crunchin" sando. I have no idea about the meat ones. Small place with TV and they have Giants games on. Only wish they had a few more veggie options, and carried better chips, like kettle or baked lays, they only have Fritos and Doritos.
author: L J.

description: Ordered the fried chicken sandwich. I only ate half cause it was filled with mayo and made me smell like a deli for like 3 hours. Not returning.
author: Anysa S.

description: Solid sandwich. Unique breads. I got the Dutch crunch, which was really good. The place has a diners, drive-ins and dives feel.
author: Josh B.

description: Seriously delicious sandwiches in the Sunset, doesn't have the lines like other places (Ike's) and is still amazing. Love getting the turkey club with all the fixings. Worth checking out if you're in the area.
author: Greg N.

description: Great place for a fantastic sandwich, reminds me of Ike's or little Luccas with a shorter line. I had a grubbin wasabi spread  sandwich with toasted Dutch crunch. Sandwich had lots of meat and good combination of texture and flavor. They have a friendly staff, and parking is easy.
author: drew w.

description: Looks like they've been listening to the reviews :) Went back and tried the "Grubbin'", and it was really good. They have come a long way since initially opening up. Seeing that, I just had to update my previous review. Thanks for listening!
author: J M.

description: Nice sandwiches with interesting names for them. Garlic fries were decent and was a nice place to stop by at Taraval. Quick lunch sandwich and had television and nice service.
author: Jackie H.

description: Dude amazing sandwiches. Shall I say more? No! Look at the menu and get something you peasant!
author: Noah K.

description: Next time I have that weird hankerin' for a fish-o-filet burger, I'm coming here! Sandwiches are juicy and bread is soft. We had the Fishin' sandwich and the Roast beef with wasabi. The kids had chicken fingers with fries, which were nothing to write home about, but I wasn't expecting much for those items.
author: N c.

description: Wow! Was looking for a good lunch after a round of golf and stumbled upon this place. Sandwiches are a good size and at a very reasonable price! I'd come back and support this place as it is a small business in SF. The Savorin and Grubbin are both full of meat and good with sauce. The Juicin will be next!
author: G Y.

description: Great sandwich spot I'm happy to have discovered. The chicken tender sandwich was bomb. Regular turkey sandwich also delicious. They where gloves making the food which is important. I will continue to be a customer.  Check in on yelp for a free bag of chips!
author: Maria D.

description:
I read about Grubbin' on SF Eater and after looking at the menu I knew I had to come in. I had high hopes and I was not disappointed. 

I had a Droolin' (Pastrami, Salami, Pepper Jack Cheese, Spicy Aioli, and Grub Sauce ) on sourdough and it was perfect. It was large, had great meat, good veggies, and the spreads were very good. The only bad thing was when I finished it, despite being very full, I still wanted a little more. 

I definitely plan on returning soon! One of the better sandwiches I have had!
author: Daniel G.

description: This place isn't all that don't know why it gets 4.5 stars. Better places around for $8-9 a sandwich. It just doesn't hit the spot since its nothing special. You can go without eating here since the ingrediants aren't great just very simple sandwich. Seems like processed ingredients since they don't have much flavor. The size of the sandwiches are surprisingly big but I would rather go to Guerra market on 14th & Taraval.
author: Len A.

description: I come here super often and love their crunchin sandwich, I'm a vegetarian and finding a good sandwich that's not just a salad in bread is rare! The servings are so big that I can actually save half for the next day and STILL stuff myself!
author: Dana F.

description: Juicin' was amazing. Good proportions for all ingredients on the sandwich and very fresh ingredients.
author: Philip R.

description: Awsome is exactly what I would say also. Sorry you didn't go WELL I'M NOT I WENT ! OOOH WOW
author: Jordan M.

description: One of the best sandwiches I've tried in SF . Must try they won't disappoint !!! Great quality sandwiches without hurting your pockets like Ike's.
author: Kristine O.

description: We ordered a juicin. Sauce is great. Bread is superb. Place is clean. 5 star for customer service and food quality. Can't wait to come here again for another one.
author: Gertty G.

description: Top notch sandwich. Let me hang out for a couple hours after I was done eating while I waited for a client meeting.
author: P. K.

description: OMG! this place had the best sandwiches hands down! My family went to the SF Zoo this past weekend and randomly googled a sandwich shop so we could sit at the beach afterwards. We ended up in their GRUBBIN shop. I ordered the Cruncher sandwich, garlic fries, and buffalo wings. ALL OF IT WAS DELICIOUS! I never leave reviews, this is my first and well deserved. The dutch crunch bread was perfect, and their pesto mayo and secret grub sauce made the sandwich orgasmic. My other family members were in awe of their sandwiches as well. I might make a trip back to Frisco just to go there again!
author: minnie r.

description: so glad I no longer have to brown bag it when I take the dogs to the vet around the corner! (I tried the chinese takeout place down the street once. no good.) I got the 'droolin' and what a masterful concoction of bread, meat and sauce it was. it took a wee bit of time to get it, but when it landed in my hands all warm and toasty, it was totally worth the wait. service is really sweet. parking is no problem. just plan on takeout because it's not really a place to sit and linger.
author: Sasha R.

description: I ate here for lunch today and it was fantastic. My girlfriend and I shared the "Grubin" on french bread and the "Juicin" on dutch crunch bread. I also found the service above average for what you would come to expect from a sandwich shop. If possible you might want to try and wait it til 12:30 on the weekdays, there is a high school around the corner and lots of students go there. It was packed when we passed to park, but as we were walking a swarm of students were heading back from lunch. When we arrived just after 12:30 we had our choice of seating.
author: Jeff S.

description: great sandwich. if you're in the area and craving a sandwich. stop in. I would. but what I wouldn't do is drive across town for it. in a town full of great sandwich shops, this one has made my list. what else can I say about grubbin' except it was grubbin'
author: buddy p.

description: This place is delicious! Spicy mouth waterin' and Juicin' sandwiches are SO good. Only thing that keeps it from being 5 stars is that the service is sometimes slow- though always friendly! They even stayed open 10 minutes late when I called in an order but couldn't make it there before closing. Highly recommend!
author: Daniel L.

description: hot and tasty.  friendly staff.  clean environment.  grubbin sauce makes turkey so amazing.
author: Choladeva C.

description: Super-friendly staff and great specialty sandwiches. The roast beef with wasabi was delightful. Hoping they will add some décor over time.
author: John L.

description: very good sandwhiches! they r huge and are very tasty!! the only thing i would of changed was to not get the grub spread because it has a little too much garlic for me.. but i will most deff come again!!
author: Megan A.

description: Grubbin is delicious! It reminds me a lot of Ikes and Mr.Pickles. You definitely need to try the spicy mouth watern' with a side of garlic fries. MMMMHHMMM
author: Brendan V.

description: Mind blowing quality sandwiches and and awesome customer service. They really treat you well, and not a horrible price!!
author: Kelly F.
